commit_message:
BSN: Set inconsistency record on delete failure

Set a bad value in the consistency DB on a delete
failure so a sync is triggered the next time the backend
servers become available.

This fixes the issue where the backend servers are unavailable
when an object is deleted from ML2 but not deleted from the
backend.

Closes-Bug: #1377350
Change-Id: I24713a03af4d3499645241f900de1f572689c235

subject: WIP: Specify Nova XML API tests clearly for juno/icehouse
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-17 04:22:06.000000000', 'files': ['test-features.sh', 'devstack-vm-gate.sh'], 'message': 'WIP: Specify Nova XML API tests clearly for juno/icehouse

TODO: need to know how to set this for icehouse branch.

XML support of Nova API has been deprecated with the following
message:
  XML support has been deprecated and may be removed as early
  as the Juno release.
Now Kilo development cycle started, so we should disable Nova
API XML tests on Tempest.

I2ab8f5c3d15b496e0b639c99bb8592533a69a265 is for adding the
configuration option to devstack and this patch specifies
Nova XML API tests are enabled for juno/icehouse clearly.
After this patch, we will disable the XML API tests as the
default setting on Tempest.

Change-Id: I40e6a420088b5e98903d76d6276dcbbe2ae47864
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Specify Nova XML API tests clearly for juno/icehouse

TODO: need to know how to set this for icehouse branch.

XML support of Nova API has been deprecated with the following
message:
  XML support has been deprecated and may be removed as early
  as the Juno release.
Now Kilo development cycle started, so we should disable Nova
API XML tests on Tempest.

I2ab8f5c3d15b496e0b639c99bb8592533a69a265 is for adding the
configuration option to devstack and this patch specifies
Nova XML API tests are enabled for juno/icehouse clearly.
After this patch, we will disable the XML API tests as the
default setting on Tempest.

Change-Id: I40e6a420088b5e98903d76d6276dcbbe2ae47864

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-11-18 22:28:44.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/dev/dev-quickstart.rst'], 'message': 'Adds help for installing prerequisites on RHEL

Certain prerequisites are not found by yum by default on RHEL. The yum
command specified in the RHEL instructions for installing prerequisites
fails to install python-pip and git-review. Adding a sentence directing
readers to use the EPEL software repository which has the missing
packages.

Closes-Bug: 1392355
Change-Id: Ibcbe9ff9e5d8eeb9f2511915d67dc53ac1dc1b63
'}]
commit_message:
Adds help for installing prerequisites on RHEL

Certain prerequisites are not found by yum by default on RHEL. The yum
command specified in the RHEL instructions for installing prerequisites
fails to install python-pip and git-review. Adding a sentence directing
readers to use the EPEL software repository which has the missing
packages.

Closes-Bug: 1392355
Change-Id: Ibcbe9ff9e5d8eeb9f2511915d67dc53ac1dc1b63

commit_message:
Adds test for deleting external network with floatingIPs

The attached neutron bug causes server to hang when deleting external network
that still has a floating IP in it.
This test should recreate the bug, and verify it is fixed

Closes-Bug: #1374573

Change-Id: Ib7d8dcbb4485e87a49cb008ace37c81f6b06a32c

commit_message:
Support instance_extra fields in expected_attrs on Instance object

This makes the fields that are stored in instance_extra specifyable
in expected_attrs for efficient queries.

Related to blueprint flavor-from-sysmeta-to-blob

Change-Id: I73567280dc1d35a3eb3badfafbe7271943e8ed57

commit_message:
Remove direct usage of the deprecated failure location

Internally we should be using the new location and not the
deprecated location wherever possible. This avoids emitting
warnings messages on our own code, which is a dirty habit.

Change-Id: Idac5a772eca7529d92542ada3be1cea092880e25

subject: Extract the state changes from the ensure storage method
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-06-27 00:27:52.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/engines/action_engine/engine.py'], 'message': 'Extract the state changes from the ensure storage method

Instead of having the ensure storage (which ensures the
atom/s storage details exist) also change the state of
the flow have the prepare method which calls into ensure
storage do these state changes instead.

Change-Id: Ic7cd13ab360e68fc33e94c67a237adeef7040159
'}]
commit_message:
Extract the state changes from the ensure storage method

Instead of having the ensure storage (which ensures the
atom/s storage details exist) also change the state of
the flow have the prepare method which calls into ensure
storage do these state changes instead.

Change-Id: Ic7cd13ab360e68fc33e94c67a237adeef7040159

commit_message:
Drop RpcProxy usage from MetadataPluginApi

Drop the usage of the RpcProxy compatibility class from
MetadataPluginApi.  The equivalent direct usage of oslo.messaging APIs
are used instead.

Part of blueprint drop-rpc-compat.

Change-Id: I1764dd715237bc76dae2789121850f69b8f82888

commit_message:
Drop usage of RpcProxy from L3PluginApi

Drop the usage of the RpcProxy compatibility class from the
L3PluginApi.  The equivalent direct usage of the oslo.messaging APIs
are now being used instead.

Part of blueprint drop-rpc-compat.

Change-Id: I6639d1aa8acca8c0544020e28489e71f3d5d2955

commit_message:
Rename generic variable named with mysql specific name

Method migrate_data in VolumeDevice class is called by all datastores.
Input variable "mysql_base" and method's description are  misleading.

Change-Id: I5c71018f8ce61b9673dd83f4fa790c8cd0dfc954
Closes-Bug: #1393511

subject: Handle the case where '_exc_type_names' is empty
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-10-25 17:27:26.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/tests/unit/test_failure.py', 'taskflow/types/failure.py'], 'message': "Handle the case where '_exc_type_names' is empty

If '_exc_type_names' is empty we want to avoid having a
index error or type error and want to handle just not writing
out the first exception type name and instead just write
out the exception text string.

Change-Id: I29fd740fd7052f73975d84ec03455170c420ca89
"}]
commit_message:
Handle the case where '_exc_type_names' is empty

If '_exc_type_names' is empty we want to avoid having a
index error or type error and want to handle just not writing
out the first exception type name and instead just write
out the exception text string.

Change-Id: I29fd740fd7052f73975d84ec03455170c420ca89

commit_message:
Update usage of LOCALRC_OLDNEW

A recent patch (#106043) localized and renamed LOCALRC_OLDNEW but
did not update all uses, causing Ironic debug logging to
end up in the wrong place and not archived on the log server.

Change-Id: I6c5b6ad3b563927fa61f79ee339bac754ad0190d

commit_message:
Fixes group by none defect in resource usage stats:

* Resets the inherited tenant filter queries that come
  from base class. The helper function for filter by
  meter expects a single query unlike project aggregates

Change-Id: Id9f371b09eaddd6c58d1181cbaeadf7654bbd067
Closes-Bug: #1387530

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-11-18 19:57:22.000000000', 'files': ['lib/ironic', 'lib/nova_plugins/hypervisor-ironic'], 'message': "Do not hardcode ironic svc port, protocol

The Ironic API server's port and protocol are hardcoded in various
places.  This updates the ironic bits to use configured values instead

commit_message:
Do not hardcode ironic svc port, protocol

The Ironic API server's port and protocol are hardcoded in various
places.  This updates the ironic bits to use configured values instead
and fixes a bug around iptables rule creationl.

Change-Id: I1ace68affff3afdbc0058be4d32f8044a24e9338
Closes-bug: #1393498

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2014-11-18 15:09:14.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/hyperv/vhdutilsv2.py', 'nova/virt/hyperv/vmops.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/hyperv/test_vhdutils.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/hyperv/test_hypervapi.py', 'nova/virt/hyperv/vhdutils.py'], 'message': 'Fixes differencing VHDX images issue on Hyper-V

When using differencing vhdx images, one will be created pointing
to the base image when a VM is spawned. This image will be created
having the according flavor size.

In this case, due to a Win32 API issue, the image is not generated
properly.

Simply creating the root image with no size specified and resizing
it afterwards fixes the issue.

Change-Id: I7bb46a63d4c2a06ed6f63c839461cbbc1abffa65
Closes-Bug: #1370531
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes differencing VHDX images issue on Hyper-V

When using differencing vhdx images, one will be created pointing
to the base image when a VM is spawned. This image will be created
having the according flavor size.

In this case, due to a Win32 API issue, the image is not generated
properly.

Simply creating the root image with no size specified and resizing
it afterwards fixes the issue.

Change-Id: I7bb46a63d4c2a06ed6f63c839461cbbc1abffa65
Closes-Bug: #1370531

commit_message:
Tolerate completely missing floating_ips

In environments, where L3 agents are disabled,
launch instances just fails due quota missing
of not necessary floating ips.

This is a Icehouse-only bugfix; The underlying
issue was fixed in Juno by a blueprint implementation
and a new config option.

Change-Id: I4f9da72b95fb6489ee3c99f0006ec7b73a7d7e87
Closes-bug: #1383614

commit_message:
Lazily interpolate strings when logging

 - Fix all logging calls to use lazy string interpolation to avoid
   unnecessarily casting megabytes of data to strings.
 - Convert congress.policy.runtime.iterstr to a class that lazily
   joins the iterable.
 - Very minor style tweaks in related blocks of code (except X as Y
   syntax, remove unnecessary parentheses, etc).

Change-Id: If2cd68a997f59d706295c0a2687e5f315c41c5e5

subject: Add benchmarking tests and various optimizations
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-18 21:22:34.000000000', 'files': ['congress/api/webservice.py', 'congress/api/table_model.py', 'congress/openstack/common/policy.py', 'congress/api/application.py', 'congress/datasources/neutron_driver.py', 'congress/datasources/datasource_driver.py', 'congress/policy/dsepolicy.py', 'congress/exception.py', 'congress/policy/tests/test_materialized.py', 'congress/server/congress_server.py', 'congress/datasources/benchmark_driver.py', 'congress/policy/unify.py', 'congress/api/row_model.py', 'congress/policy/tests/test_unify.py', 'congress/utils.py', 'congress/tests/base.py', 'congress/tests/helper.py', 'congress/policy/tests/brokentest_runtime.py', 'congress/dse/deepsix.py', 'congress/policy/tests/snapshot/classification', 'congress/policy/runtime.py', 'congress/policy/compile.py', 'congress/tests/test_congress.py', 'congress/harness.py', 'congress/dse/d6cage.py', 'congress/datasources/ceilometer_driver.py', 'congress/dse/dataobj.py', 'tox.ini', 'congress/datasources/test_driver.py', 'congress/tests/test_benchmark_updates.py'], 'message': "Add benchmarking tests and various optimizations

 - Add a benchmarking mechanism based on the existing unit test plumbing.
 - Fix all logging calls to use lazy string interpolation to avoid unnecessarily casting megabytes of data to strings.
 - Convert congress.policy.runtime.iterstr to a class that lazily joins the iterable.
 - Eliminate redundant for loops from congress.policy.runtime.Runtime.initialize().
 - Convert congress.policy.compile.Term.create_from_python() to a static method, cutting about 5% from policy processing time.
 - Convert congress.policy.runtime.NonrecursiveRuleTheory contents to OrderedSets. This slashed test_benchmark_datasource_to_policy_update_large() from head-death-of-the-universe (at 2k rows, it took 9.7s while 20k rows didn't finish even after 30 minutes) to a manageable 13.5s for 100k rows.

Change-Id: I25d0d1e77fcae190e956241ee18df48a31bda809
"}]
commit_message:
Add benchmarking tests and various optimizations

 - Add a benchmarking mechanism based on the existing unit test plumbing.
 - Fix all logging calls to use lazy string interpolation to avoid unnecessarily casting megabytes of data to strings.
 - Convert congress.policy.runtime.iterstr to a class that lazily joins the iterable.
 - Eliminate redundant for loops from congress.policy.runtime.Runtime.initialize().
 - Convert congress.policy.compile.Term.create_from_python() to a static method, cutting about 5% from policy processing time.
 - Convert congress.policy.runtime.NonrecursiveRuleTheory contents to OrderedSets. This slashed test_benchmark_datasource_to_policy_update_large() from head-death-of-the-universe (at 2k rows, it took 9.7s while 20k rows didn't finish even after 30 minutes) to a manageable 13.5s for 100k rows.

Change-Id: I25d0d1e77fcae190e956241ee18df48a31bda809

commit_message:
Pin oslo.db < 1.1.0 until bug 1393633 is fixed

The postgresql opportunistic test has started
failing pretty frequently due to a race for shared
sessions with the database since oslo.db 1.1.0 was
released, so pin the required version under 1.1.0
until the bug is fixed.

Change-Id: Id013608813a2e10aa8856c7e1f89a5380eb9ef8e
Related-Bug: #1393633

commit_message:
Cleanup coreos-oem-inject.py

The current script used to inject the IPA container into CoreOS is
not pep8 compliant, has requirements that are not in
global-requirements, and never has tests run. Now requirement on
plumbum is removed, script is pep8 compliant, flake8 runs against the
script when tests are run.

Closes-bug: #1337551

Change-Id: I14d3e46e60c4e072f34f80dc50d7214079953f49

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-18 19:39:11.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/solidfire.py'], 'message': "Fix typo in SolidFire xDBVersionMismatch label

The retryable errors list in the SolidFire driver includes
an xDBVersionMismatch error that can be emitted from the
device.  During some recent work however the spelling of
the error was incorrect, so it's never deteceted/retried
as it should be.

This patch fixes the typo from 'xDBVersionMisMatch' to
xDBVersionMismatch'.

Change-Id: I5b4bf908c6a9146c4554e5749cd12dbc46c6e7c1
Closes-Bug: #1393916
"}]
commit_message:
Fix typo in SolidFire xDBVersionMismatch label

The retryable errors list in the SolidFire driver includes
an xDBVersionMismatch error that can be emitted from the
device.  During some recent work however the spelling of
the error was incorrect, so it's never deteceted/retried
as it should be.

This patch fixes the typo from 'xDBVersionMisMatch' to
xDBVersionMismatch'.

Change-Id: I5b4bf908c6a9146c4554e5749cd12dbc46c6e7c1
Closes-Bug: #1393916

commit_message:
Changing PureISCSIDriver to use % string formatting instead of .format

Removing usage of .format for string formatting to be more in line with
OpenStack standards. Adding appropiate usage of _LE,_LW,_LI as well.

Change-Id: I4f411920293553d1356012c7db803c9b2dcf593f
Closes-bug: #1392063

be used but if an admin wants to use the volume ID instead they can

commit_message:
Adding support for 'source-id' in 3PAR manage

Changed 3PAR's manage volume functionality to support the use of a
'source-id' id-type.  By default the name of the volume to manage can
be used but if an admin wants to use the volume ID instead they can
set the optional --id-type argument to 'source-id' now.

Closes-Bug: 1357075
Change-Id: I503beefc594f03627d2273f48c80326cf80fbdef

subject: Update cinder.conf.sample to fix max db conn retries
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-18 17:21:24.000000000', 'files': ['etc/cinder/cinder.conf.sample'], 'message': 'Update cinder.conf.sample to fix max db conn retries

Another external library change (oslo.db) has broken the gate
because cinder.conf.sample appears to be out of date.  The change
was just to a message string:

   Maximum number of database connection retries during
   startup. Set to -1 to specify an infinite retry count. (integer value)
   ->
   Maximum db connection retries during startup. Set to -1 to
   specify an infinite retry count. (integer value)

This patch updates cinder.conf.sample to get beyond this failure.  The
Cinder team will be talking about how to avoid these issues in the future.

Change-Id: Ia14954842d141b9bd208ce98c5a70a42b014ac45
(cherry picked from commit 969a27c56e8c69ba7420d98a0c123dce2ad16870)
'}]
commit_message:
Update cinder.conf.sample to fix max db conn retries

Another external library change (oslo.db) has broken the gate
because cinder.conf.sample appears to be out of date.  The change
was just to a message string:

   Maximum number of database connection retries during
   startup. Set to -1 to specify an infinite retry count. (integer value)
   ->
   Maximum db connection retries during startup. Set to -1 to
   specify an infinite retry count. (integer value)

This patch updates cinder.conf.sample to get beyond this failure.  The
Cinder team will be talking about how to avoid these issues in the future.

Change-Id: Ia14954842d141b9bd208ce98c5a70a42b014ac45
(cherry picked from commit 969a27c56e8c69ba7420d98a0c123dce2ad16870)

commit_message:
Make Cloud Loadbalancer properties updatable

Several Cloud Loadbalancer properties that are updatable in the Cloud
Loadbalancers API were not updatable in the Heat resource.  Add
handle_update for each of these properties.

Change-Id: Ie1de3461ef2114b64195f9cb906caebd853be381
Closes-Bug: #1382665

commit_message:
Add username to Assembly table

Adding the ‘username’ from context to the Assembly table. This is to
support some of the impersonation work that will be done to support
enterprises that use keystone v2, which does not support trusts.

Change-Id: I95c18c24190da48e36d8918bbe7085f6a81a016f

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2014-10-24 16:46:37.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/long-lived-transactionalized-db-fixtures.rst'], 'message': 'db: Add long-lived-transactionalized-db-fixtures

This feature will overhaul the system by which oslo.db provides
connectivity and fixture support for database-enabled tests. The new
features will allow tests to be run against any number of database
backends, to allow "opportunistic" backend URLs to be specified on a
per-environment basis, as well as to allow any number of successive
tests to run against a fixed schema that is maintained across tests
without the need to rebuild the schema on each test.

Change-Id: I47cfe81b6169b64ff001ebbe28998f0df9b6f1fe
'}]
commit_message:
db: Add long-lived-transactionalized-db-fixtures

This feature will overhaul the system by which oslo.db provides
connectivity and fixture support for database-enabled tests. The new
features will allow tests to be run against any number of database
backends, to allow "opportunistic" backend URLs to be specified on a
per-environment basis, as well as to allow any number of successive
tests to run against a fixed schema that is maintained across tests
without the need to rebuild the schema on each test.

Change-Id: I47cfe81b6169b64ff001ebbe28998f0df9b6f1fe

of oslo.db.session.EngineFacade.

commit_message:
db: Make EngineFacade a Facade

This blueprint proposes a new declarative
system of connection management and
session and transaction scoping for
all projects that currently make use
of oslo.db.session.EngineFacade.

subject: Ensure dir permissions are 755 for cleanup to work
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 6554, 'name': 'Spencer Krum', 'email': 'nibz@spencerkrum.com', 'username': 'krum-spencer'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 7979, 'name': 'Mikhail S Medvedev', 'email': 'mihailmed@gmail.com', 'username': 'msmedved'}, {'_account_id': 12182, 'name': 'azher ullah khan', 'email': 'azher.khan@oracle.com', 'username': 'AzherKhan'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-20 20:57:20.000000000', 'files': ['functions.sh'], 'message': 'Ensure dir permissions are 755 for cleanup to work

cleanup_host uses wildcards to copy several files. For example,

  sudo cp /etc/sudoers.d/* $BASE/logs/sudoers.d/

This wildcard expansion would not work if the sudoers.d does not
have read permission for others. The lack of permission would result
in "cp: cannot stat ..." error when a wildcard is used. This error
can currently be seen for sudoers.d in devstack-gate-cleanup-host.txt

With this patch we fix the permissions so that the expansion works for
/etc/sudoers.d and for /var/log/libvirtd/.

The latter is not needed on Ubuntu, but fixes similar issue on
Fedora 20. We do not use is_fedora check because it would just add
clutter, and the permission fix does not have any side effects as we
are cleaning up.

Further permission fixes could be necessary and this patch is in no
way covers all the cases.

Change-Id: Ia068c2356ad6fa27052ef4b38d1a95701f7cf6ac
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure dir permissions are 755 for cleanup to work

cleanup_host uses wildcards to copy several files. For example,

  sudo cp /etc/sudoers.d/* $BASE/logs/sudoers.d/

This wildcard expansion would not work if the sudoers.d does not
have read permission for others. The lack of permission would result
in "cp: cannot stat ..." error when a wildcard is used. This error
can currently be seen for sudoers.d in devstack-gate-cleanup-host.txt

With this patch we fix the permissions so that the expansion works for
/etc/sudoers.d and for /var/log/libvirtd/.

The latter is not needed on Ubuntu, but fixes similar issue on
Fedora 20. We do not use is_fedora check because it would just add
clutter, and the permission fix does not have any side effects as we
are cleaning up.

Further permission fixes could be necessary and this patch is in no
way covers all the cases.

Change-Id: Ia068c2356ad6fa27052ef4b38d1a95701f7cf6ac

revisions:

Certain prerequisites are not found by yum by default on RHEL. The yum
command specified in the RHEL instructions for installing prerequisites
fails to install python-pip and git-review. Adding a sentence directing
readers to use the EPEL software repository which has the missing

Change-Id: I6ff44773d4a0850c64f0eddc808164c3f91ef429

commit_message:
Adds help for installing prerequisites on RHEL

Certain prerequisites are not found by yum by default on RHEL. The yum
command specified in the RHEL instructions for installing prerequisites
fails to install python-pip and git-review. Adding a sentence directing
readers to use the EPEL software repository which has the missing
packages.

Closes-Bug: 1392355
Change-Id: I6ff44773d4a0850c64f0eddc808164c3f91ef429

subject: Improved error handling in kafka_consumer
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-11-18 19:09:26.000000000', 'files': ['monagent/collector/checks_d/kafka_consumer.py'], 'message': 'Improved error handling in kafka_consumer

If the kafka_consumer plugin encounters an error fetching consumer offsets
(like for a partition which is configured but no longer exists), it can
start to allocate threads and never close them oout.  I added additional
exception handling around fetching both consumer and broker offsets so
that the plugin will log errors, but not fail altogether, and not cause
runaway thread usage.

Change-Id: I03e6f7cc3ecd787d7b4ad54b74136540607a465a
'}]
commit_message:
Improved error handling in kafka_consumer

If the kafka_consumer plugin encounters an error fetching consumer offsets
(like for a partition which is configured but no longer exists), it can
start to allocate threads and never close them oout.  I added additional
exception handling around fetching both consumer and broker offsets so
that the plugin will log errors, but not fail altogether, and not cause
runaway thread usage.

Change-Id: I03e6f7cc3ecd787d7b4ad54b74136540607a465a

subject: Add pycrypto install to swift-proxy element
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-18 13:55:08.000000000', 'files': ['elements/swift-proxy/install.d/swift-source-install/76-swift-proxy'], 'message': "Add pycrypto install to swift-proxy element

We've encountered an issue with memcache encryption of authtoken
entries on Swift proxies where the authtoken middleware errors
out since pycrypto isn't installed.  This has been exposed on
standalone Swift servers.  To fix the issue, we've modified the
swift-proxy element so that pycrypto is installed along with
keystonemiddleware and python-swiftclient.

Change-Id: I727087a85df7ed94fd0ecac86c78826328e644f4
Closes-Bug: #1393790
"}]
commit_message:
Add pycrypto install to swift-proxy element

We've encountered an issue with memcache encryption of authtoken
entries on Swift proxies where the authtoken middleware errors
out since pycrypto isn't installed.  This has been exposed on
standalone Swift servers.  To fix the issue, we've modified the
swift-proxy element so that pycrypto is installed along with
keystonemiddleware and python-swiftclient.

Change-Id: I727087a85df7ed94fd0ecac86c78826328e644f4
Closes-Bug: #1393790

subject: Do not create a tenant for network quota tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-24 21:44:47.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/network/admin/test_quotas.py'], 'message': 'Do not create a tenant for network quota tests

Neutron does not validate the tenant id passed to the quota
extension with Keystone. This means that it is not necessary
to create a tenant before performing these tests.

This patch remove tenant/creation deletion code, thus simplifying
the test itself. It also ensures the cleanup action for tenant
quotas is executed once. The second execution indeed would just
remove a record which has already been removed.
The above condition does not return an error because neutron
return a 204 response in this case.

Change-Id: I698cfd33bffcb5712fd613a81712e4b31f460ec4
'}]
commit_message:
Do not create a tenant for network quota tests

Neutron does not validate the tenant id passed to the quota
extension with Keystone. This means that it is not necessary
to create a tenant before performing these tests.

This patch remove tenant/creation deletion code, thus simplifying
the test itself. It also ensures the cleanup action for tenant
quotas is executed once. The second execution indeed would just
remove a record which has already been removed.
The above condition does not return an error because neutron
return a 204 response in this case.

Change-Id: I698cfd33bffcb5712fd613a81712e4b31f460ec4

apparently when cleaning up the python-*clients to not be in the
integrated gate, I missed removing that from heatclient. In the libs

do, and the source jobs are really the important ones.

Change-Id: I45bb269d700cbd9cdf90b6b9d99df18ded444fdf
"}]
commit_message:
remove python-heatclient from integrated gate

apparently when cleaning up the python-*clients to not be in the
integrated gate, I missed removing that from heatclient. In the libs
from pypi world the integrated gate jobs don't do what you think they
do, and the source jobs are really the important ones.

Will also let python-heatclient merge code faster as it will be
decoupled from the integrated gate pipeline.

Change-Id: I45bb269d700cbd9cdf90b6b9d99df18ded444fdf

subject: Allow a subtranslator to use a field from the parent table as an id
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-11-18 18:39:22.000000000', 'files': ['congress/datasources/tests/unit/test_datasource_driver.py', 'congress/datasources/datasource_driver.py'], 'message': "Allow a subtranslator to use a field from the parent table as an id

In the previous version, a subtranslator always computed a new id based on the
subtable's content.  This change allows a subtranslator to use a column from
the parent table in the subtable's id column.

For example, the following translator:
  list_translator = {'translation-type': 'LIST',
                     'table-name': 'subtable',
                     'parent-key': 'foreign-key',
                     'val-col': 'val_col',
                     'translator': self.value_trans}
  translator = {'translation-type': 'HDICT', 'table-name': 'testtable',
                'selector-type': 'DICT_SELECTOR',
                'field-translators': ({'fieldname': 'foreign-key',
                                       'translator': self.value_trans},
                                      {'fieldname': 'foo',
                                       'translator': list_translator})}

Would turn the following objects
 {'foreign-key': 100, 'foo': (1, 2)}
 {'foreign-key': 101, 'foo': (3, 4)}

into these tables:

  testtable  subtable
  100        100, 1
  101        100, 2
             101, 3
             101, 4

Change-Id: I5b337c9bf7ba3af3ecf7732215cba38b6f923a95
"}]
commit_message:
Allow a subtranslator to use a field from the parent table as an id

In the previous version, a subtranslator always computed a new id based on the
subtable's content.  This change allows a subtranslator to use a column from
the parent table in the subtable's id column.

For example, the following translator:
  list_translator = {'translation-type': 'LIST',
                     'table-name': 'subtable',
                     'parent-key': 'foreign-key',
                     'val-col': 'val_col',
                     'translator': self.value_trans}
  translator = {'translation-type': 'HDICT', 'table-name': 'testtable',
                'selector-type': 'DICT_SELECTOR',
                'field-translators': ({'fieldname': 'foreign-key',
                                       'translator': self.value_trans},
                                      {'fieldname': 'foo',
                                       'translator': list_translator})}

Would turn the following objects
 {'foreign-key': 100, 'foo': (1, 2)}
 {'foreign-key': 101, 'foo': (3, 4)}

into these tables:

  testtable  subtable
  100        100, 1
  101        100, 2
             101, 3
             101, 4

When ofa and ovs neutron agents start, they use the linux utility
'udevadm'.  It is passed as an argument with an absolute directory path
which can vary on each linux install.  By removing the directory path,

commit_message:
Execute udevadm on other linux installs

When ofa and ovs neutron agents start, they use the linux utility
'udevadm'.  It is passed as an argument with an absolute directory path
which can vary on each linux install.  By removing the directory path,
it will find this utility by way of the user's environment path since
linux executables are configured in each user's path upon user creation.

Change-Id: I2344290d38c7889b8f32d8fb9c5161b09826e037
Closes-bug:  #1367697

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-18 04:58:03.000000000', 'files': ['etc/cinder/policy.json'], 'message': 'Disable Cgsnapshot APIs by default

Currently consistency group APIs are disabled by default because there are
only a very small number of drivers that have implemented them. In
cinder/etc/cinder/policy.json, there are the following entries:

    "consistencygroup:create" : "group:nobody",
    "consistencygroup:delete": "group:nobody",
    "consistencygroup:get": "group:nobody",
    "consistencygroup:get_all": "group:nobody",
    "consistencygroup:create_cgsnapshot" : "",
    "consistencygroup:delete_cgsnapshot": "",
    "consistencygroup:get_cgsnapshot": "",
    "consistencygroup:get_all_cgsnapshots": "",

Note that Cgsnapshot related APIs are not disabled by default. They should be
disabled to be consistent. So the policy entries will be changed to the
following in this patch:

    "consistencygroup:create" : "group:nobody",
    "consistencygroup:delete": "group:nobody",
    "consistencygroup:get": "group:nobody",
    "consistencygroup:get_all": "group:nobody",
    "consistencygroup:create_cgsnapshot" : "group:nobody",
    "consistencygroup:delete_cgsnapshot": "group:nobody",
    "consistencygroup:get_cgsnapshot": "group:nobody",
    "consistencygroup:get_all_cgsnapshots": "group:nobody",

Note: If a driver has CG functions implemented, the CG APIs have to be enabled
by changing "group:nobody" to "" for the CG functions to work.

Change-Id: If59b3da1e84e25e1f547793638c58966e10f488c
Closes-Bug: #1393652
'}]
commit_message:
Disable Cgsnapshot APIs by default

Currently consistency group APIs are disabled by default because there are
only a very small number of drivers that have implemented them. In
cinder/etc/cinder/policy.json, there are the following entries:

    "consistencygroup:create" : "group:nobody",
    "consistencygroup:delete": "group:nobody",
    "consistencygroup:get": "group:nobody",
    "consistencygroup:get_all": "group:nobody",
    "consistencygroup:create_cgsnapshot" : "",
    "consistencygroup:delete_cgsnapshot": "",
    "consistencygroup:get_cgsnapshot": "",
    "consistencygroup:get_all_cgsnapshots": "",

Note that Cgsnapshot related APIs are not disabled by default. They should be
disabled to be consistent. So the policy entries will be changed to the
following in this patch:

    "consistencygroup:create" : "group:nobody",
    "consistencygroup:delete": "group:nobody",
    "consistencygroup:get": "group:nobody",
    "consistencygroup:get_all": "group:nobody",
    "consistencygroup:create_cgsnapshot" : "group:nobody",
    "consistencygroup:delete_cgsnapshot": "group:nobody",
    "consistencygroup:get_cgsnapshot": "group:nobody",
    "consistencygroup:get_all_cgsnapshots": "group:nobody",

Note: If a driver has CG functions implemented, the CG APIs have to be enabled
by changing "group:nobody" to "" for the CG functions to work.

Change-Id: If59b3da1e84e25e1f547793638c58966e10f488c
Closes-Bug: #1393652

commit_message:
Prefer X-Backend-Timestamp for X-Newest

When a X-Backend-Timestamp is available it would generally preferred
over a less specific value and sorts correctly against any X-Timestamp
values anyway.

will be supported by the puppet-openstack community.  This patch will
integrate the puppet module in the OpenStack infrastructure
workflow.

a.Failed to create CG in the storage:

  sending API to back-end storage, the "-" word in the CG uuid

commit_message:
Fix a problem in creating consistency group in ProphetStor driver.

a.Failed to create CG in the storage:
  Storage site cannot accept CG uuid including "-" word. Before
  sending API to back-end storage, the "-" word in the CG uuid
  needs to be removed.
b.Failed to delete volume of CG:
  Corrected api leaving group operation key.

Change-Id: I017b2f65c4da6961219f0b972edae2b1cb447878
Closes-Bug: 1391724

These autogenerated tests are wrong in at least 2 ways, one is
assumptions about when servers are available, and the other a schema
which makes assumptions about the resource end points that are
provably wrong when you look at the Nova code (which is unchanged for
2 years).

It's not clear there is any value generated from these tests, suggest

Change-Id: I4822546f73055e307017960bd470333c81cdea01"}]
commit_message:
Delete console negative tests

These autogenerated tests are wrong in at least 2 ways, one is
assumptions about when servers are available, and the other a schema
which makes assumptions about the resource end points that are
provably wrong when you look at the Nova code (which is unchanged for
2 years).

It's not clear there is any value generated from these tests, suggest
to delete them.

Related-Bug: #1392860

Change-Id: I4822546f73055e307017960bd470333c81cdea01

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-10-27 14:03:14.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/tests/test_list_tests.py', 'tempest/scenario/utils.py'], 'message': "Fix unit tests to detect import failures

This commit adds onto the existing unit test which simply runs
'testr list-tests' to run discovery on tempest. This is done to ensure
that from a bare tempest repo with the requirements all present we can
actually import and list all the tests. However, there wasn't a check
of the return code. Historically this has been an issue with discovery
failing so adding a check to enforce it moving forward should prevent
it from slipping back in. Part of this is to also fix the test so that
it runs discovery on the correct test suite.

In order to make the unit test pass a config dependency in the
scenario test test_basic_server_ops during the testscenarios call in
load_tests had to be removed. Instead if there is a configuration
error raised while running load tests on this module instead of
failing it will just return the base test class. This is fine
because the test itself will fail on the same configuration
dependencies that load_tests is, however it won't happen silently
during discovery anymore.

Change-Id: Ie74c020de7c9c27adc4ff68dddbae5d4481d1224
"}]
commit_message:
Fix unit tests to detect import failures

This commit adds onto the existing unit test which simply runs
'testr list-tests' to run discovery on tempest. This is done to ensure
that from a bare tempest repo with the requirements all present we can
actually import and list all the tests. However, there wasn't a check
of the return code. Historically this has been an issue with discovery
failing so adding a check to enforce it moving forward should prevent
it from slipping back in. Part of this is to also fix the test so that
it runs discovery on the correct test suite.

In order to make the unit test pass a config dependency in the
scenario test test_basic_server_ops during the testscenarios call in
load_tests had to be removed. Instead if there is a configuration
error raised while running load tests on this module instead of
failing it will just return the base test class. This is fine
because the test itself will fail on the same configuration
dependencies that load_tests is, however it won't happen silently
during discovery anymore.

Change-Id: Ie74c020de7c9c27adc4ff68dddbae5d4481d1224

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-11-18 09:48:49.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_security_group_default_rules.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/security_group_default_rules.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/security_group_default_rules.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': 'Fix rule not found error in sec grp default rule API

In V2.1 "os-security-group-default-rules", when default rule is not
found then, DB raise exception - 'SecurityGroupDefaultRuleNotFound'.

Further SecurityGroupAPI->get_all_default_rules() try to catch
'NotFound' exception where it would not be able to catch DB raised
exception because that is derived from 'Invalid' exception.

So during not found situation, SecurityGroupDefaultRulesController
should try to catch 'SecurityGroupDefaultRuleNotFound' instead of
'SecurityGroupNotFound'.

Currently 500 error is thrown in not found case.

This patch also catch those exception in V2 API.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: Ib1c5a02ae19c872afb90e79ad13be8d39394ba97
'}]
commit_message:
Fix rule not found error in sec grp default rule API

In V2.1 "os-security-group-default-rules", when default rule is not
found then, DB raise exception - 'SecurityGroupDefaultRuleNotFound'.

Further SecurityGroupAPI->get_all_default_rules() try to catch
'NotFound' exception where it would not be able to catch DB raised
exception because that is derived from 'Invalid' exception.

So during not found situation, SecurityGroupDefaultRulesController
should try to catch 'SecurityGroupDefaultRuleNotFound' instead of
'SecurityGroupNotFound'.

Currently 500 error is thrown in not found case.

This patch also catch those exception in V2 API.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: Ib1c5a02ae19c872afb90e79ad13be8d39394ba97

in constant form, those have been refactored. Also global configuration
changes are now handled by functions to enhance code readability.

commit_message:
Include call to delete_subnet from delete_network at DB level

Removes an extra lock in bsn plugin that causes a deadlock
when delete_subnet is invoked form delete_network, agreed
with kevinbenton to remove it
Modifies a unit test to cover this change per reviewer request
Co-author amirosh

Closes-bug: #1197176

Change-Id: Ie3414848a91cc737b16b79399ae19800545e533f

commit_message:
Remove obsolete methods from tempest service client

Commit https://github.com/openstack/manila/commit/2c7595a3
implemented "share servers" approach and removed Manila share-network
activation/deactivation APIs. Manila service client in Tempest plugin was not
updated with this API change and several redundant methods left.

Change-Id: Idd76fed790f8bfc9f7e3502e10dd130bbe5f5bfd

commit_message:
Remove templatedir directive from puppet.conf

Debian-based packaging adds a templatedir parameter to puppet.conf
This is deprecated in puppet and hence adds a lot of deprecated warning
clutter/spam when running the integration tests.

Change-Id: Ie929328cbd7f1231f716cd468887aa579dbe2a07

subject: Have prop attribute access return None by default
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-14 19:45:06.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/resource.py', 'openstack/tests/test_resource.py', 'openstack/network/v2/security_group.py'], 'message': "Have prop attribute access return None by default

resource.prop.__get__ raising an AttributeError as a default value leads
to some interesting code on the user end. An example is in our own code,
in the SecurityGroup initializer, where we try to look into
security_group_rule to convert them from raw data to SecurityGroupRule
objects. That whole loop is wrapped in a try/except for AttributeError,
which would pick up more than the issue of an unset security_group_rule
object, and is not entirely friendly.

Return None as a default value for unset properties. This makes using
them and checking if they've been set much more simple, rather than
having to wrap a lot of your app code in checks for AttributeError.

Change-Id: Iee3e62c10eaed7ecb1a4a882864cc3dd81ad227c
"}]
commit_message:
Have prop attribute access return None by default

resource.prop.__get__ raising an AttributeError as a default value leads
to some interesting code on the user end. An example is in our own code,
in the SecurityGroup initializer, where we try to look into
security_group_rule to convert them from raw data to SecurityGroupRule
objects. That whole loop is wrapped in a try/except for AttributeError,
which would pick up more than the issue of an unset security_group_rule
object, and is not entirely friendly.

Return None as a default value for unset properties. This makes using
them and checking if they've been set much more simple, rather than
having to wrap a lot of your app code in checks for AttributeError.

Change-Id: Iee3e62c10eaed7ecb1a4a882864cc3dd81ad227c

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-10-22 23:39:33.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/iscsi.py', 'cinder/tests/test_iscsi.py', 'cinder/brick/iscsi/iscsi.py'], 'message': "TgtAdm: Don't change CHAP username/password on live migration

As tgtd doesn't update CHAP username/password while the initiator is
connected, CHAP username/password must not be changed while a Nova
instance are performing live-migration; otherwise the compute node
which the instance migrates to cannot login to the volume and the
migration process is aborted.

This fixes TgtAdm implementation not to regenerate random
username/password every time initialize_connection is called.
Also, it enables CHAP auth in unit tests of TargetAdmin helpers.

Change-Id: I48729a33fada62a7c8e4fe500b1e39533d898701
Closes-Bug: #1383509
"}]
commit_message:
TgtAdm: Don't change CHAP username/password on live migration

As tgtd doesn't update CHAP username/password while the initiator is
connected, CHAP username/password must not be changed while a Nova
instance are performing live-migration; otherwise the compute node
which the instance migrates to cannot login to the volume and the
migration process is aborted.

This fixes TgtAdm implementation not to regenerate random
username/password every time initialize_connection is called.
Also, it enables CHAP auth in unit tests of TargetAdmin helpers.

Change-Id: I48729a33fada62a7c8e4fe500b1e39533d898701
Closes-Bug: #1383509

Enhancements to X-IO volume driver to support extra-specs
and qos-specs. Supported specs will cover QoS IOPSmin, IOPSmax,
IOPSburst, affinity, thin.

Blueprint:

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/xio-iscsi-fc-volume-driver

commit_message:
Add QoS, media affinity and thin allocation support to X-IO volume driver

Enhancements to X-IO volume driver to support extra-specs
and qos-specs. Supported specs will cover QoS IOPSmin, IOPSmax,
IOPSburst, affinity, thin.

Blueprint:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/xio-volume-driver-1-1

Dependency:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/xio-iscsi-fc-volume-driver

Change-Id: I9a59ef5b9b45ae9d597f80328b702d6342abb36f

commit_message:
Correctly stop functional servers

When running integration tests, the test suite starts real zaqar
servers. The tearDown class was not stopping those servers correctly,
which made the test suite re-use server instances when that was not
necessary, causing other tests to fail.

Change-Id: Ie701a8a609f8661c3607890c4b1b37ab110b155b
Closes-bug: #1383604

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-11-14 13:37:26.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Add Werkzeug>=0.7 to global-requirements.txt

Werkzeug>=0.7 is a direct dependency of Designate, and a transitive
dependency of the Flask WSGI framework used by Designate and
Ceilometer.

Werkzeug is a stable + actively maintained collection of WSGI
utilities, providing the basis for the Flask WSGI framework. The
codebase supports Python 2.6, 2.7 and 3.3, is licenced under

commit_message:
Add Werkzeug>=0.7 to global-requirements.txt

Werkzeug>=0.7 is a direct dependency of Designate, and a transitive
dependency of the Flask WSGI framework used by Designate and
Ceilometer.

Werkzeug is a stable + actively maintained collection of WSGI
utilities, providing the basis for the Flask WSGI framework. The
codebase supports Python 2.6, 2.7 and 3.3, is licenced under
the BSD licnese, and is packaged on Ubuntu, Debian, Fedora.

Change-Id: I955dc03010c9988f0dc989217c5c084eede34fb5

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2014-11-14 12:47:10.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/manager.py', 'tempest/scenario/test_swift_basic_ops.py'], 'message': 'Use addCleanup when running swift scenario tests

Helper methods that create containers or objects are now responsible
for providing insurance that the container and object are removed.
delete_wrapper is used so that test cases may choose to delete objects
themselves and the resulting failure to cleanup in addCleanup will
not be an error.

Because deletion is a reasonable "basic op" scenario, the deletion
tests in test_swift_basic_ops are updated so they explicitly
validate deletion while also using addCleanup as a safety measure in
the event the test has unexpected failures.

Change-Id: I70b7172e9485cbd1eb881db3b2add3860da0935a
'}]
commit_message:
Use addCleanup when running swift scenario tests

Helper methods that create containers or objects are now responsible
for providing insurance that the container and object are removed.
delete_wrapper is used so that test cases may choose to delete objects
themselves and the resulting failure to cleanup in addCleanup will
not be an error.

Because deletion is a reasonable "basic op" scenario, the deletion
tests in test_swift_basic_ops are updated so they explicitly
validate deletion while also using addCleanup as a safety measure in
the event the test has unexpected failures.

Change-Id: I70b7172e9485cbd1eb881db3b2add3860da0935a

commit_message:
Remove commented out codes and files related to upgrade-packages

This commit removes some unnecessary commented out codes and files they
are related to upgrade-packages. Upgrading package was part of the
original vision of Grenade. However the scope of upgrades was cut back
now. Because any package upgrades required should be handled in the
service that requires them as Dean Troyer said.

commit_message:
Cleanup docs - raises class

The argument to the :raises: directive is the class name. If the
class name is a valid reference it's rendered as a link to the
class. This change cleans up the :raises: directives to use the
reference correctly and use a valid class reference.

Change-Id: I84188b60de0ab4c6b5b2fb5a203c43bfde094707

subject: Check server group policy on migrate/evacuate
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-11-18 16:40:54.000000000', 'files': ['nova/scheduler/utils.py', 'nova/tests/unit/conductor/test_conductor.py', 'nova/conductor/manager.py', 'nova/conductor/tasks/live_migrate.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/test_scheduler_utils.py', 'nova/tests/unit/conductor/tasks/test_live_migrate.py'], 'message': "Check server group policy on migrate/evacuate

This patch changes server group checking in the instance group setup.
Previously, it checked for the presence of the 'group' scheduler hint
as an indication that the instance was a member of a group.  However,
that hint is only present on initial boot.  It is not present when the
scheduler is being used to pick a destination for a migration or
evactuate.

The updated logic checks the database to see if the instance is a
member of a group.  For performance reasons, it only does this is
server group functionality is enabled in the scheduler (group filters
are enabled).

This change makes it so server group policy enforcement will still
occur for migrations and evactuations, instead of only on first boot.

It also adds the call to setup_instance_group in evacuate, resize,
cold migrate and live migrate methods because now it is possible to
access the group setup.

Implements blueprint anti-affinity-on-migration

Closes-bug: #1379451

Change-Id: If17ff56d9601e2d126c158d2d9eb36ac3ac5878f
"}]
commit_message:
Check server group policy on migrate/evacuate

This patch changes server group checking in the instance group setup.
Previously, it checked for the presence of the 'group' scheduler hint
as an indication that the instance was a member of a group.  However,
that hint is only present on initial boot.  It is not present when the
scheduler is being used to pick a destination for a migration or
evactuate.

The updated logic checks the database to see if the instance is a
member of a group.  For performance reasons, it only does this is
server group functionality is enabled in the scheduler (group filters
are enabled).

This change makes it so server group policy enforcement will still
occur for migrations and evactuations, instead of only on first boot.

It also adds the call to setup_instance_group in evacuate, resize,
cold migrate and live migrate methods because now it is possible to
access the group setup.

Implements blueprint anti-affinity-on-migration

Closes-bug: #1379451

Custom variables

subject: Filter out some Tempest tests for Nova cells
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-11-18 17:15:05.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'message': 'Filter out some Tempest tests for Nova cells

We would like to get a set of Tempest tests running against Nova cells
that is expected to pass given the current functionality provided.
This is being done via regexes so that we can spend the bulk of our
effort on cellsv2 and put the current cells feature into maintenance
mode quickly.

Change-Id: I0c6047ca66d4d740f8ca0bc67a258bb36db8dbfe
'}]
commit_message:
Filter out some Tempest tests for Nova cells

We would like to get a set of Tempest tests running against Nova cells
that is expected to pass given the current functionality provided.
This is being done via regexes so that we can spend the bulk of our
effort on cellsv2 and put the current cells feature into maintenance
mode quickly.

Change-Id: I0c6047ca66d4d740f8ca0bc67a258bb36db8dbfe

Remove -full designation from cells job

In preparation for paring down the tests that the cells job runs it has
been renamed without the -full designation.  There was an existing cells

commit_message:
Can't Access Default Pool through API

  Since the default pool had a tenant_id = Null, not even an
  admin could access it through the API. This fixes that.

  Closes-Bug:#1392748

Change-Id: I5238b119ee62dc168ac3bfc5875619c1e07eac60

commit_message:
Initial commit from github (squashed)

These were the commits from github repo(s)

  84d943e Initial commit
  3d15bd1 Created the pecan project for containers for API
  b49297b Added rest functionality to the v2 apis
  227e1dd Added rest functionality to the v2 apis
  39500ae Added the base API call like POST, GET, PUT & DELETE.
  e404e94 adding wsme support to pecan
  f90f540 Added wsme support to the magnum apis
  c879329 added changes to api
  24ebc32 Fixed the bugs in the container apis
  01725ef Rename dir from containers to magnum
  1a1375a Add requirements and test-requirements
  f957e2e Add ASL2.0 license
  8f4c0ee Move tests to the proper location
  48dd100 Move setup files to proper directory
  86cc435 Fix the setup so the installation is sanitary
  b766d59 Make the installation and tox testing work
  c477236 This is a new project - start with v1 for api
  cf20cac Remove pep8 errors
  d23b325 Merge with code generated using OpenStack cookie-cutter
  b6b9f34 Ability to run pecan serve from command line

Had to update requirements.txt to get jobs working

Change-Id: I068389412d023c258bda40dfbdff5a40f2e7d175
Co-Authored-By: Digambar Patil <digambarpat@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Steven Dake <sdake@redhat.com>

subject: Do not perform PKI setup with init-keystone
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-05 09:00:56.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/devtest_seed.sh', 'scripts/devtest_undercloud.sh', 'scripts/devtest_overcloud.sh'], 'message': "Do not perform PKI setup with init-keystone

Now that generate-keystone-pki performs PKI for us, init-keystone's
calling out to keystone-manage's pki_setup is pointless, since it
just prints that the certs already exist and exits. Turn it off.

Change-Id: Iaf0eb7f74c862213b6812bb20104658378c56153
"}]
commit_message:
Do not perform PKI setup with init-keystone

Now that generate-keystone-pki performs PKI for us, init-keystone's
calling out to keystone-manage's pki_setup is pointless, since it
just prints that the certs already exist and exits. Turn it off.

Change-Id: Iaf0eb7f74c862213b6812bb20104658378c56153

commit_message:
Add Ironic hardware deployment support

Currently devstack create VMs and then deploy Ironic on these VMs.
Sometimes developer may want to deploy on real platform.

A separated file is required to provide the baremetal compute node
information, which includes four fields for each hardware platform,
the ipmi address, the mac address, the ipmi user name and the
password.

Change-Id: I422b43eae6edc95f15b8c40383d0ba7fbcd9b1ff

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-11-17 04:07:29.000000000', 'files': ['lib/tempest'], 'message': 'Add TEMPEST_ENABLE_NOVA_XML_API option

XML support of Nova API has been deprecated with the following
message:
  XML support has been deprecated and may be removed as early
  as the Juno release.
Now Kilo development cycle started, so we should disable Nova
API XML tests on Tempest.

This patch adds TEMPEST_ENABLE_NOVA_XML_API option for setting
Tempest test by devstack-gate. The default value is True because
of keeping the test coverage. After merging a devstack-gate patch
which specifes True for stable/icehouse and stable/juno, we will
set False for the master blanch.

I4acc15ce5f487738bb34a95c2261a5d05d827d8d is a Nova patch which
removes XML API support.

Change-Id: I2ab8f5c3d15b496e0b639c99bb8592533a69a265
'}]
commit_message:
Add TEMPEST_ENABLE_NOVA_XML_API option

XML support of Nova API has been deprecated with the following
message:
  XML support has been deprecated and may be removed as early
  as the Juno release.
Now Kilo development cycle started, so we should disable Nova
API XML tests on Tempest.

This patch adds TEMPEST_ENABLE_NOVA_XML_API option for setting
Tempest test by devstack-gate. The default value is True because
of keeping the test coverage. After merging a devstack-gate patch
which specifes True for stable/icehouse and stable/juno, we will
set False for the master blanch.

I4acc15ce5f487738bb34a95c2261a5d05d827d8d is a Nova patch which
removes XML API support.

Change-Id: I2ab8f5c3d15b496e0b639c99bb8592533a69a265

subject: Always recurse updates into nested stacks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-12 19:29:39.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_autoscaling_update_policy.py', 'heat/engine/stack_resource.py', 'heat/tests/test_provider_template.py'], 'message': "Always recurse updates into nested stacks

Currently, the determination whether to actually update a nested
stack is made based on the properties passed in to the provider
resource interface.  Unfortunately this doesn't consider the
definition of the nested stack, thus any changes to the nested
template definition will be ignored when any update happens.

So instead, override the default resource base-class logic and
force the update to recurse into nested stacks, where the base
class logic will be applied as normal on a per-resource basis.

Change-Id: I547f570b038e080daefa9a96f1ce3b438ce9bb2b
Partial-Bug: #1389499
"}]
commit_message:
Always recurse updates into nested stacks

Currently, the determination whether to actually update a nested
stack is made based on the properties passed in to the provider
resource interface.  Unfortunately this doesn't consider the
definition of the nested stack, thus any changes to the nested
template definition will be ignored when any update happens.

So instead, override the default resource base-class logic and
force the update to recurse into nested stacks, where the base
class logic will be applied as normal on a per-resource basis.

Change-Id: I547f570b038e080daefa9a96f1ce3b438ce9bb2b
Partial-Bug: #1389499

commit_message:
Allow specifying all flavor types

In I1b653020acf4b5acb510ba4a092f854815e36a87, support was added to
allow operators to specify the flavor they wished to use for control
and compute nodes, but this missed two other types that operators may
wish to change, namely block storage and swift storage.

Change-Id: I8a009bc1feaa34a98d20f5c18ea29145c00d428c

commit_message:
Remove unused methods from utils.py

Most of these methods were imported when we forked away from
python-novaclient, but over the course of time, their existence
became redundant as no file seems to be importing them. Such
methods are removed in this change.

commit_message:
Performance tests for handling nodes in Fuel Client

For performance testing all invotations to Nailgun
were mocked in order to only measure pure client's
performance.

The patch introduces the following tests for 100 nodes:

- list all nodes;
- assign nodes to an environment;
- list environment with pending nodes;
- upload network parameters to nodes.

Blueprint: 100-nodes-support
Change-Id: I849ecd17ba4a9a48b8d4e6dafa75b095ee919ce6

commit_message:
fix shell syntax in set_roots

The git-filter-branch script assumes Bourne shell syntax, not bash
syntax. Fix the conditional generated for set_roots so it works under
old-style Bourne shell.

Change-Id: I75350f5f20a7bccf76d35d803cae2eb6827292a5

commit_message:
make COOKIECUTTER_TEMPLATE_REPO configurable

If the user has specified a COOKIECUTTER_TEMPLATE_REPO use it instead of
the default. This is useful for testing changes to the cookiecutter
template locally before publishing them.

Change-Id: I047030e77a08650bea5930be53012df97c29263b

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 1420, 'name': 'Adam Gandelman', 'email': 'adamg@ubuntu.com', 'username': 'gandelman-a'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 9009, 'name': 'Red Hat CI', 'email': 'redhatci@redhat.com', 'username': 'redhatci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-11-17 20:32:31.000000000', 'files': ['lib/ironic', 'tools/ironic/templates/vm.xml', 'tools/ironic/scripts/configure-vm', 'files/apts/ironic', 'files/rpms/ironic'], 'message': "Log early boot of Ironic VMs to serial with sgabios

This adds sgabios to the list of packages for Ironic and configures
the libvirt domain to redirect BIOS messages to serial via sgabios,
when console logging is enabled.  The sgabios package in Ubuntu
currently has an apparmor bug, so that is worked around here.

This allows visibility into early boot of Ironic nodes and should
help get to the bottom of a frequent failure we're seeing in the gate.

Change-Id: Ifd18851e2d23d198d36e67883a81afc6a92d2a58
Related-Bug: #1393099
"}]
commit_message:
Log early boot of Ironic VMs to serial with sgabios

This adds sgabios to the list of packages for Ironic and configures
the libvirt domain to redirect BIOS messages to serial via sgabios,
when console logging is enabled.  The sgabios package in Ubuntu
currently has an apparmor bug, so that is worked around here.

This allows visibility into early boot of Ironic nodes and should
help get to the bottom of a frequent failure we're seeing in the gate.

Change-Id: Ifd18851e2d23d198d36e67883a81afc6a92d2a58
Related-Bug: #1393099

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-11-03 12:11:56.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/task/helpers.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/fixtures/openstack.yaml', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/base.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/unit/test_redeployment_scenarios.py'], 'message': 'Redeploy cinder/compute nodes if new controller added

Addition of new controller affects cluster messaging,
particularly cinder/computes nodes which is reliant on
rabbitmq_hosts settings

In current orchestration model - the only way to
fix configuration on nodes is to redeploy them.
Configuration will be applied from /etc/astute.yaml and
it is not enough to simply add additional PostDeployment
method in astute

Introduced additional setting for roles_metadata:
- update_required
  should store list of roles that dependends on this role

On deployment stage:
- make update_required list for the whole cluster
- select ready nodes without pending_roles and deploy them

No migration added to keep behaviour on old clusters as it is

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: 1368445

Change-Id: I1735a8b06531018b1240726f5faa4f7ce6e6a631
'}]
commit_message:
Redeploy cinder/compute nodes if new controller added

Addition of new controller affects cluster messaging,
particularly cinder/computes nodes which is reliant on
rabbitmq_hosts settings

In current orchestration model - the only way to
fix configuration on nodes is to redeploy them.
Configuration will be applied from /etc/astute.yaml and
it is not enough to simply add additional PostDeployment
method in astute

Introduced additional setting for roles_metadata:
- update_required
  should store list of roles that dependends on this role

On deployment stage:
- make update_required list for the whole cluster
- select ready nodes without pending_roles and deploy them

No migration added to keep behaviour on old clusters as it is

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: 1368445

Change-Id: I1735a8b06531018b1240726f5faa4f7ce6e6a631

commit_message:
Added asterisk for required field Key

On the Flavor Extra Specs tab, when the user tries to create
'Other Key' it is also marked as required field. Since this
field it is optional, this validation will be deleted on the
other cases.

Change-Id: I2474a174073535ab5b40c3d6c9683f16f89a38a9
Closes-Bug: #1289565

commit_message:
Refactoring of Horizon navigation

    Horizon navigation is now lighter and written in a full less way.
It overrides bootstrap values when needed, and has been moved to
dedicated files. This changes will offer a better maintainability.
The design has also been changed in a less is more way.
    This patch also remove the old navigation elements (css, html
and python stuff).

Change-Id: Ia0a79b9337d5610ba54cad4f459619972db3a174
Implements: blueprint css-breakdown
Co-Authored-By: miziel-r <robert.mizielski@cloudwatt.com>

commit_message:
Split workflows and wizards in dedicated files

    Workflows and wizards are two different components and need to be
separate in dedicated files.
    In addition the less syntax has been used for a better comprehension.

Change-Id: I28ac74eaebffbd09bef203669a206f855df7b5b2
Implements: blueprint css-breakdown

commit_message:
Made Size parameter optional while creating DB Instance.

While creating Database Instance size parameter depends on
whether trove_volume_support is set. So size paramater is
made optional in horizon.

Change-Id: I6710751f9805af5a2a4c26db8f0edb7206fe6af5
Closes-Bug: #1301359

subject: Error when swift Pseudo-folder includes "="
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-02 09:25:08.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/containers/views.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/containers/tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/containers/tables.py'], 'message': 'Error when swift Pseudo-folder includes "="

When a swift Pseudo folder or container name contains a special character, the special character
first gets encoded because of the fix provided for Bug #1231904. The reverse() function of Django
version 1.6 will again encode the special character. Hence in this patch unnecessary urlquote()
have been removed. Unit test cases are updated.

Change-Id: I1e25f8daacbd8d370e409aeb8b7b31becfd8ed0a
Closes-Bug: #1327035
'}]
commit_message:
Error when swift Pseudo-folder includes "="

When a swift Pseudo folder or container name contains a special character, the special character
first gets encoded because of the fix provided for Bug #1231904. The reverse() function of Django
version 1.6 will again encode the special character. Hence in this patch unnecessary urlquote()
have been removed. Unit test cases are updated.

Change-Id: I1e25f8daacbd8d370e409aeb8b7b31becfd8ed0a
Closes-Bug: #1327035

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-11-17 16:18:15.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Add barbican-cover to check pipeline

The Barbican team would like to generate coverage reports during the
check pipeline so that we can verify coverage before merging a new
patch. The new coverage job is marked as non-voting.

Change-Id: I86b9eee015f9eea1412b5596c720ffb9415a4e97
'}]
commit_message:
Add barbican-cover to check pipeline

The Barbican team would like to generate coverage reports during the
check pipeline so that we can verify coverage before merging a new
patch. The new coverage job is marked as non-voting.

Change-Id: I86b9eee015f9eea1412b5596c720ffb9415a4e97

commit_message:
don't start radosgw service from puppet

radosgw can't properly initialize until the Ceph cluster is populated
with enough OSD nodes, and we already have radosgw restart as a
post-deployment action in Astute.

Closes-Bug: #1390649
Change-Id: If7eaa9371f498f04876b84a4b6420440af26a9ff

commit_message:
Fix problem for 'System Information' page

In get_context_data, exceptions.handle raises error if we get error in
try-block. Set context['version'] to 'not available' and write warning
message to logs instead of calling exceptions.handle().

Change-Id: Id35658e44ac074c10dea06baa074b1e320147c41
Closes-Bug: #1387665

commit_message:
Always use FakeMemcache for in-process tests

Better isolation and consistency for in-process functests to always use
the FakeMemcache.  If you want to test the real memcache you have real
functional tests.

Change-Id: Ic483f794e122130bd7694c9a5f9a2b1cd0b9a653

* jenkins/scripts/project-requirements-change.py: If not reading
requirements in strict mode, for example when analyzing the existing
branch tip copy of a list, allow for the possibility that

Change-Id: I8e13a5e94901f615233ddfb4a5e4589841a01853
'}]
commit_message:
Make existing requirements parsing more forgiving

* jenkins/scripts/project-requirements-change.py: If not reading
requirements in strict mode, for example when analyzing the existing
branch tip copy of a list, allow for the possibility that
pkg_resources may be incapable of parsing what it sees as a
malformed version string.

Change-Id: I8e13a5e94901f615233ddfb4a5e4589841a01853

subject: Make in process functional tests use sample proxy-server.conf
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 995, 'name': 'David Goetz', 'email': 'david.goetz@rackspace.com', 'username': 'david-goetz'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 7233, 'name': 'Matthew Oliver', 'email': 'matt@oliver.net.au', 'username': 'mattoliverau'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 9625, 'name': 'Thiago da Silva', 'email': 'thiagodasilva@gmail.com', 'username': 'thiago'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-11-14 10:45:59.000000000', 'files': ['etc/proxy-server.conf-sample', 'test/functional/__init__.py'], 'message': "Make in process functional tests use sample proxy-server.conf

This patch was first motivated by noticing that the proxy
server pipeline used for in process functional tests was
out of date with respect to the pipeline in
/etc/proxy-server.conf.sample. Rather than cut and paste
the current pipeline into the in process setup, it seems
like a better idea would be to have the in process tests
always use the sample config.

A further benefit is that in process functional tests will
pick up changes to the sample config introduced by patches -
previously test/functional/__init__.py would need to be
manually modified to run in process functional tests
on new middleware for example.

Note: because the pipeline is now loaded using entry points,
'python setup.py [develop|install]' will now be needed
before running the tests.

Obvious next steps would be to do the same for the backend
servers, and to allow alternative config files and dir's
to be specified, but this patch is the first step.

Also drive-by fixes some typos in proxy-server.conf.sample

Change-Id: If442bd7c2b1721ec92839c4490924ba33e1545d8
"}]
commit_message:
Make in process functional tests use sample proxy-server.conf

This patch was first motivated by noticing that the proxy
server pipeline used for in process functional tests was
out of date with respect to the pipeline in
/etc/proxy-server.conf.sample. Rather than cut and paste
the current pipeline into the in process setup, it seems
like a better idea would be to have the in process tests
always use the sample config.

A further benefit is that in process functional tests will
pick up changes to the sample config introduced by patches -
previously test/functional/__init__.py would need to be
manually modified to run in process functional tests
on new middleware for example.

Note: because the pipeline is now loaded using entry points,
'python setup.py [develop|install]' will now be needed
before running the tests.

Obvious next steps would be to do the same for the backend
servers, and to allow alternative config files and dir's
to be specified, but this patch is the first step.

Also drive-by fixes some typos in proxy-server.conf.sample

Change-Id: If442bd7c2b1721ec92839c4490924ba33e1545d8

commit_message:
Add empty id_rsa.pub for nailgun settings template

Commit 5106d31ee80a683c618fada7b0186263e1d20a28 adds a
nailgun dependency on /root/.ssh/id_rsa.pub, but docker
build fails because it doesn't exist during this phase.

Change-Id: Ib36adcebe188627ed62b24b81e708edafd52cdaf
Closes-Bug: #1392698

commit_message:
switch to oslo.middleware

- openstack.common.middleware has graduated to oslo.middleware. this
patch changes default to oslo.middleware
- entry_points added to support backward compatibility (similar to
oslo.messaging)

Change-Id: I108c63a545fd8533c6518caff73b420d0486e5a1

commit_message:
Use host puppet manifests for containers

Potentially conflicts with upgrades, but useful
for feature of testing puppet changes with
Fuel CI. /etc/puppet of host system is now
mounted read only inside containers.

Docimpact: impact on puppet manifests for testing

blueprint fuel-master-ci-tests

Change-Id: I63a13fbd5b105c3b4326ad53125dbc4ae06e502e

subject: Added pycrypto>=2.6 to requirements.txt
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-11-13 13:45:19.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'test-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Added pycrypto>=2.6 to requirements.txt

We've encountered an issue with memcache encryption of authtoken
entries where the authtoken middleware errors out since pycrypto
isn't installed.  This has been exposed on standalone Swift servers
deployed using TripleO.  To fix the issue, we've added pycrypto
to the requirements.txt file, so that installing Keystonemiddleware
will force the installation of pycrypto.

Change-Id: I76370163a3ed5ff447ae990272f9ce8e35fa27b0
Closes-Bug: #1392264
"}]
commit_message:
Added pycrypto>=2.6 to requirements.txt

We've encountered an issue with memcache encryption of authtoken
entries where the authtoken middleware errors out since pycrypto
isn't installed.  This has been exposed on standalone Swift servers
deployed using TripleO.  To fix the issue, we've added pycrypto
to the requirements.txt file, so that installing Keystonemiddleware
will force the installation of pycrypto.

Change-Id: I76370163a3ed5ff447ae990272f9ce8e35fa27b0
Closes-Bug: #1392264

commit_message:
Add resource types for JSON-Schema validation

There are resources cross projects like volume, network, etc.
Now the validation implementations for each resource exist at
the different places.
This patch adds resource types and makes schemas use these types
for code cleanup.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: Ia74f59cc8dc77c95b07f167e8f02cee6d82318f3

subject: Fix Trove gate timeout
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-18 12:23:04.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/trove.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix Trove gate timeout

Reasons:
 - Trove gate-trove-functional-dsvm-mysql gate hits timeout. For example:
   job started at: 2014-11-17 01:16:00.264 | Started by user anonymous
   job failed at: 2014-11-17 02:51:01.244 | Build timed out (after 95 minutes).
                  Marking the build as failed.

Changes:
 - extending timeout to 180 minutes to allow all other tests to pass

Change-Id: Ibb82952d22e5a993a3266d456849f478bb311928
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Trove gate timeout

Reasons:
 - Trove gate-trove-functional-dsvm-mysql gate hits timeout. For example:
   job started at: 2014-11-17 01:16:00.264 | Started by user anonymous
   job failed at: 2014-11-17 02:51:01.244 | Build timed out (after 95 minutes).
                  Marking the build as failed.

Changes:
 - extending timeout to 180 minutes to allow all other tests to pass

Change-Id: Ibb82952d22e5a993a3266d456849f478bb311928

a DOT-graph.

Performance profiling settings are stored in settings.yaml

commit_message:
Basic profiling facilities for CLI

This patch implements a simple wrapper for
profiling different CLI commands and saving
the results.

cProfile is used as a profiling tool; results
are saved as a call-tree, textual statistics and
a DOT-graph.

Performance profiling settings are stored in settings.yaml
which is introduced by this patch and is distributed with
Fuel Client. Custom user settings can be supplied using the
FUELCLIENT_CUSTOM_SETTINGS environment variable overriding
the default ones.

DocImpact
Blueprint: 100-nodes-support
Change-Id: Ia9f6d19960fbe35e034fa85bf6303f3a419a7a75

commit_message:
Use common get_instance call in API plugins part 2

Cleanup API to use common get_instance call which
automatically does exception handling. These changes
are in a separate patch because they required some
unittest changes because of the manner in which some
methods were originally stubbed out.

Change-Id: Ide92ba84cc937191d25da0d643e8e4427a9aa8c7

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-11-18 08:31:23.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/clients.py'], 'message': 'Add internal methods for setting compute clients

If disabling XML tests on compute API tests by the config item
"xml_api_v2", we need to switch XML clients to JSON clients on
the other project API tests. But current code is difficult to
switch, because compute clients are many and the order is mess.
This patch adds internal methods to set compute clients for
cleanup.

Change-Id: I62bf48845c289b86f1af71e9fbf71e45b509a43d
'}]
commit_message:
Add internal methods for setting compute clients

If disabling XML tests on compute API tests by the config item
"xml_api_v2", we need to switch XML clients to JSON clients on
the other project API tests. But current code is difficult to
switch, because compute clients are many and the order is mess.
This patch adds internal methods to set compute clients for
cleanup.

Change-Id: I62bf48845c289b86f1af71e9fbf71e45b509a43d

commit_message:
Fix oslo.messaging funtional tests job template

Reasons:
 - bash 'case' statement misses 'in' statement, because of them recent
   experimental jobs are failing due to syntax error:

subject: ResourceGroup don't special-case zero count
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-17 17:40:33.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/resource_group.py', 'heat/tests/test_resource_group.py'], 'message': "ResourceGroup don't special-case zero count

Currently, when you specify an initial count of zero, we don't
create the nested stack.  Unfortunately this then means you can
never update it, which makes the group forever broken..

Instead, always create the stack on create, even if it's an empty
stack containing zero resources.  This allows subsequent updates
which move to a non-zero count to work as expected.

Change-Id: I494229fcf85a1c28428fa2925c060fc1f40f4f36
Closes-Bug: #1392796
"}]
commit_message:
ResourceGroup don't special-case zero count

Currently, when you specify an initial count of zero, we don't
create the nested stack.  Unfortunately this then means you can
never update it, which makes the group forever broken..

Instead, always create the stack on create, even if it's an empty
stack containing zero resources.  This allows subsequent updates
which move to a non-zero count to work as expected.

Change-Id: I494229fcf85a1c28428fa2925c060fc1f40f4f36
Closes-Bug: #1392796

commit_message:
Only configure Nova DB connection if it is set

The Nova db connection parameter isn't always required. If
you use the conductor you would not need to set this
parameter on your compute nodes for example.

Change-Id: I6901e9d0f781f7ba83d58a2c41343bd80dd9215c
