NeutronIPAM as IPAM subsystem

This implements NeutronIPAM that has been proposed in the
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/neutron-ipam.

The goal is to create NeutronIPAM as a pluggable IPAM subsytem
so that any 3rd party vendor can create her own IPAM drvier
by inherting interfaces defined in NeutronIPAM and adding
the vendor specific behaviors that utilize the vendor's
own external IPAM backends.

IPAM subsystem allows a 3rd party IPAM driver to extend the
capability of managing networks/subnets, fixed/floating IP
addresses, and DNS records.

IPAM subsystem creates "ipam" folder under neutron.
The folder contains base.py that provides interfaces for
IPAM management classes.

There are four interface classes defined in the base module.

*IPAMManager* is the main class that defines IPAM driver
behaviors and make use of business logics that are defined
in the three controller classes: IPAMController,
DHCPController, and DNSController

IPAMController enables network management capabiltiy,
DHCPController DHCP management, and DNSController
DNS record managements.

"drivers" folder is created right under the "ipam".
There exists "neutron_ipam" module as the default
neutron driver. The module has NeutronIPAM that
implements IPAMManager, NeutronDHCPController that
implements DHCPController, NeutronDNSController that
implements DNSController.

A 3rd party vendor can create her own driver by creating
a vendor folder under "drivers" and create a driver by
implementing IPAMController, DHCPController, and
DNSController and also by inheriting NeutronIPAM,
NeutronDHCPController, and NeutronDNSController classes.

Change-Id: I7cb4fa2a5c73944b986554196e1001166c148821
'}]
commit_message:
Implements: blueprint neutron-ipam

NeutronIPAM as IPAM subsystem

This implements NeutronIPAM that has been proposed in the
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/neutron-ipam.

The goal is to create NeutronIPAM as a pluggable IPAM subsytem
so that any 3rd party vendor can create her own IPAM drvier
by inherting interfaces defined in NeutronIPAM and adding
the vendor specific behaviors that utilize the vendor's
own external IPAM backends.

IPAM subsystem allows a 3rd party IPAM driver to extend the
capability of managing networks/subnets, fixed/floating IP
addresses, and DNS records.

IPAM subsystem creates "ipam" folder under neutron.
The folder contains base.py that provides interfaces for
IPAM management classes.

There are four interface classes defined in the base module.

*IPAMManager* is the main class that defines IPAM driver
behaviors and make use of business logics that are defined
in the three controller classes: IPAMController,
DHCPController, and DNSController

IPAMController enables network management capabiltiy,
DHCPController DHCP management, and DNSController
DNS record managements.

"drivers" folder is created right under the "ipam".
There exists "neutron_ipam" module as the default
neutron driver. The module has NeutronIPAM that
implements IPAMManager, NeutronDHCPController that
implements DHCPController, NeutronDNSController that
implements DNSController.

A 3rd party vendor can create her own driver by creating
a vendor folder under "drivers" and create a driver by
implementing IPAMController, DHCPController, and
DNSController and also by inheriting NeutronIPAM,
NeutronDHCPController, and NeutronDNSController classes.

Change-Id: I7cb4fa2a5c73944b986554196e1001166c148821

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-11-17 22:44:03.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/api/v2/volumes.py', 'cinder/tests/api/v2/test_volumes.py'], 'message': 'allow image_id for imageRef in create volume API v2

The create volume request for the V2 API has a property named
"imageRef" with the ID of the image to be used when creating the
volume.
The name of this property is inconsistent as all multi word
properties use snake case and the property in the reponse is named
"image_id".

This adds support for aliasing the imageRef key with image_id when
creating a volume in v2 of the Cinder API in a backward-compatible
way.

Change-Id: I85a5c6734ba05a8a7ea9eff3f849d12fb3d167fb
Closes-Bug: 1375867
'}]
commit_message:
allow image_id for imageRef in create volume API v2

The create volume request for the V2 API has a property named
"imageRef" with the ID of the image to be used when creating the
volume.
The name of this property is inconsistent as all multi word
properties use snake case and the property in the reponse is named
"image_id".

This adds support for aliasing the imageRef key with image_id when
creating a volume in v2 of the Cinder API in a backward-compatible
way.

Change-Id: I85a5c6734ba05a8a7ea9eff3f849d12fb3d167fb
Closes-Bug: 1375867

subject: RandomString physical_resource_id as id not the string
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-11-18 00:27:05.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/random_string.py', 'heat/tests/test_random_string.py'], 'message': "RandomString physical_resource_id as id not the string

If someone choses a string length of over 255 we overflow the DB
id field causing an error, so instead use the physical name 
for the resource_id.

The actual string is already stored (encrypted) in the resource_data
so it's probably better anyway to refer to the value in one place
and just override FnGetRefId to maintain the existing interface behavior.

Change-Id: Ide8899a2aa0a9fed037835dc46225f52c291ace6
Closes-Bug: #1392359
"}]
commit_message:
RandomString physical_resource_id as id not the string

If someone choses a string length of over 255 we overflow the DB
id field causing an error, so instead use the physical name 
for the resource_id.

The actual string is already stored (encrypted) in the resource_data
so it's probably better anyway to refer to the value in one place
and just override FnGetRefId to maintain the existing interface behavior.

Change-Id: Ide8899a2aa0a9fed037835dc46225f52c291ace6
Closes-Bug: #1392359

commit_message:
Support libvirt memory backing in nova.

Generate memory backing elements in libvirt.xml according to configuration
in nova.conf

For Example: libvirt_mem_backing=hugepages=true, nosharepages=false

Change-Id: I12eae18afe5b95190eac594515dfdf145fd0bdc6
Implements: blueprint virt-driver-large-pages

commit_message:
Moves node resource tests to a separate testcase

As an effort to split the Nova driver test cases, this patch
moves node resource to its own testcase class. The testscenarios module
was used since the tests share the same test routine.

Partial-bug: 1325906

Change-Id: Ic8fca63d3dfc47ddf1141179646f5ce3794b4ffe

revisions:
[{'number': 25, 'created': '2014-11-15 08:08:41.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/ovs_lib.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/interface.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/iptables_firewall.py', 'neutron/agent/metadata/namespace_proxy.py', 'neutron/agent/l3_agent.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/iptables_manager.py', 'neutron/hacking/checks.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/async_process.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py', 'neutron/agent/securitygroups_rpc.py', 'neutron/agent/rpc.py', 'neutron/agent/netns_cleanup_util.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_hacking.py', 'neutron/agent/dhcp_agent.py', 'neutron/agent/metadata/agent.py', 'neutron/agent/ovs_cleanup_util.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/ovsdb_monitor.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/daemon.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/utils.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_l3_agent.py', 'HACKING.rst'], 'message': "Update i18n translation for neutron.agents log msg's

Don't translate debug level logs and enforce log hints
Our translation policy
(https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/LoggingStandards#Log_Translation) calls
for not translating debug level logs. This is to help prioritize log
translation. Furthermore translation has a performance overhead, even if
the log isn't used (since neutron doesn't support lazy translation yet).

NOTE: this is done on a directory by directory basis to ensure that we
do not have too many conflicts and rebases.

Add a local hacking rule to enforce this.

This patch set enforces the directory neutron/agents

Partial-bug: #1320867

Change-Id: I4bd562e5138c2d2850072440aa121f27e902463a
"}]
commit_message:
Update i18n translation for neutron.agents log msg's

Don't translate debug level logs and enforce log hints
Our translation policy
(https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/LoggingStandards#Log_Translation) calls
for not translating debug level logs. This is to help prioritize log
translation. Furthermore translation has a performance overhead, even if
the log isn't used (since neutron doesn't support lazy translation yet).

NOTE: this is done on a directory by directory basis to ensure that we
do not have too many conflicts and rebases.

Add a local hacking rule to enforce this.

This patch set enforces the directory neutron/agents

Partial-bug: #1320867

Change-Id: I4bd562e5138c2d2850072440aa121f27e902463a

commit_message:
Moving horizon compression offline

Making the horizon scss compilation and compression happen offline.
Potentially fixing an issue with parallel compression in devstack.

Related-Bug: #1345955

commit_message:
Creating individual resources for vpnaas test case

As per design there is only one vpn-service object per router.
Tempest test cases were failing due to creation of multiple
vpn service object for the same single router by raising an
router in use execption.so creating individual resources for
each test cases.

Closes-Bug: 1376104

Change-Id: Id327488c039374160bbfaa9705b869a38aa0583c

(HTTP 400, Bad Request), otherwise the method will be invoked and the HTTP

commit_message:
Vendor endpoints to support different HTTP methods

This patch extend the VendorPassthru and DriverVendorPasshtru endpoints
to support to any HTTP method.

When creating a new vendor function developers can specify which are the
HTTP methods supported by each vendor function as a list, if the method
request is not in the list Ironic will return a InvalidParameterValue
(HTTP 400, Bad Request), otherwise the method will be invoked and the HTTP
method request will be available to the vendor function as a parameters
in kwargs called 'http_method'.

Partial-Bug: #1382457
Implements: blueprint extended-vendor-passthru
Change-Id: I01d9d7fdd7eaf9849db41d50fbb4a78fd31bbfdc

subject: Fix horizon package install
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-05 09:59:05.000000000', 'files': ['elements/horizon/os-refresh-config/post-configure.d/14-horizon'], 'message': 'Fix horizon package install

We need to copy the local_settings.py file over to the packaged location,
similar to what we do for the source install. Otherwise, config changes to
local_settings.py applied by os-apply-config are not actually in effect. We
must also edit the file to adjust the STATIC_ROOT location.

Add a missing "set -o pipefail" as well.

Change-Id: Ibe0df1596238b5b7f15ac75ce751bc7312b67479
'}]
commit_message:
Fix horizon package install

We need to copy the local_settings.py file over to the packaged location,
similar to what we do for the source install. Otherwise, config changes to
local_settings.py applied by os-apply-config are not actually in effect. We
must also edit the file to adjust the STATIC_ROOT location.

Add a missing "set -o pipefail" as well.

Change-Id: Ibe0df1596238b5b7f15ac75ce751bc7312b67479

subject: Fix incorrect service name on Debian in `add-rule`
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-10 18:55:53.000000000', 'files': ['elements/iptables/svc-map', 'elements/iptables/bin/add-rule'], 'message': 'Fix incorrect service name on Debian in `add-rule`

On Debian, the iptables-persistent service has been renamed to
netfilter-persistent. The svc-map includes both default, ubuntu,
and debian as ubuntu will "fallback" to debian as they are considered
the same family of distro.

Change-Id: I180a580820015a60ceb2221873a38ebbb06cf953
'}]
commit_message:
Fix incorrect service name on Debian in `add-rule`

On Debian, the iptables-persistent service has been renamed to
netfilter-persistent. The svc-map includes both default, ubuntu,
and debian as ubuntu will "fallback" to debian as they are considered
the same family of distro.

Change-Id: I180a580820015a60ceb2221873a38ebbb06cf953

commit_message:
Make resource check messages more consistent

This adds a method to be used in handle_check calls to make error
messages more consistent, as well as making sure that all unexpected
messages get displayed in the status_reason field, as opposed to
stopping on the first error.

Change-Id: Id855886ae42eabd78dafc6514eca9eebf905f291
Implements: blueprint stack-check

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-14 10:36:05.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/cli/simple_read_only/volume/test_cinder.py'], 'message': 'Remove "Disabled Reason" from test_cinder_service_list

The CLI test test_cinder_service_list checks the output of
"cinder service-list" for a set of column titles. One of the titles
it expects to find is "Disabled Reason". However, this title is not
guaranteed to be in the output; cinderclient only appends it if
the value shows up in the response from the server.

Change-Id: I060bad255ff17b132737a8878c26e7d5cf9dce82
Closes-Bug: #1392662
'}]
commit_message:
Remove "Disabled Reason" from test_cinder_service_list

The CLI test test_cinder_service_list checks the output of
"cinder service-list" for a set of column titles. One of the titles
it expects to find is "Disabled Reason". However, this title is not
guaranteed to be in the output; cinderclient only appends it if
the value shows up in the response from the server.

Change-Id: I060bad255ff17b132737a8878c26e7d5cf9dce82
Closes-Bug: #1392662

commit_message:
unconfigured clients look in the [clients] section for defaults

This change enables clients that have no specific settings in
the [clients_xxx] sections of the configuration file to get defaults
from the [clients] section.

Change-Id: I071bd77a2e1f0ad366b80c095917a8debc5cef2b
Closes-Bug: 1379958

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1005, 'name': "Eamonn O'Toole", 'email': 'eamonn.otoole@hp.com', 'username': 'eamonn-otoole'}, {'_account_id': 1253, 'name': 'Gerry Drudy', 'email': 'gerry.drudy@hpe.com', 'username': 'gerry-drudy'}, {'_account_id': 1926, 'name': 'Derek Higgins', 'email': 'derekh@redhat.com', 'username': 'derekh'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 7585, 'name': 'Ladislav Smola', 'email': 'lsmola@redhat.com', 'username': 'lsmola'}, {'_account_id': 8688, 'name': 'Alexis Lee', 'email': 'openstack@lxsli.co.uk', 'username': 'lxsli'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-11-12 17:08:46.000000000', 'files': ['swift-storage.yaml', 'swift-storage-source.yaml', 'swift-deploy.yaml', 'swift-source.yaml'], 'message': "Add swift.mount-check metadata

We've submitted a patch (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/130172/)
to set the value of mount_check to swift.mount-check if it exists,
and otherwise to set mount_check to false.  By default TripleO
deployments set mount_check to false since they do not use mounted
disks to store data.  However we (HP) and others are now using
TripleO to deploy Swift servers with mounted drives for data, in
which case mount_check should be set to True.  This change adds
swift.mount-check data and sets it to the value of the
SwiftMountCheck parameter, which has a default value of False.

Change-Id: I36fece56bafa9fe9c4883b572687b3fc819eeae1
"}]
commit_message:
Add swift.mount-check metadata

We've submitted a patch (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/130172/)
to set the value of mount_check to swift.mount-check if it exists,
and otherwise to set mount_check to false.  By default TripleO
deployments set mount_check to false since they do not use mounted
disks to store data.  However we (HP) and others are now using
TripleO to deploy Swift servers with mounted drives for data, in
which case mount_check should be set to True.  This change adds
swift.mount-check data and sets it to the value of the
SwiftMountCheck parameter, which has a default value of False.

Change-Id: I36fece56bafa9fe9c4883b572687b3fc819eeae1

commit_message:
Logrotate more aggressively on debug mode

Debug log rotation occurs every 10 minutes,
so that disk space can be conserved when running
applications with high volume of logs.

Change-Id: Ia50d3b0ec96a9ef411238bea0e6d162ca02ebe08
Closes-Bug: #1393404

subject: Translate psycopg2 errors/exceptions into tooz exceptions
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2014-11-18 10:11:38.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'tooz/tests/test_postgresql.py', 'tooz/drivers/pgsql.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Translate psycopg2 errors/exceptions into tooz exceptions

Instead of raising raw psycopg2 errors/exceptions from the
postgresql driver we should make an attempt to translate
those errors/exceptions into a equivalent tooz exception to
make it so that users of tooz can handle the known driver
failure modes in a sane manner (users expecting to user tooz
as a pluggable abstraction will not be able to handle raw
psycopg2 errors/exceptions, especially if those users are
using different tooz backends at the same time).

Change-Id: Ic95e5fa21bb25096a31b5c5e38aa0b14afa05d87
'}]
commit_message:
Translate psycopg2 errors/exceptions into tooz exceptions

Instead of raising raw psycopg2 errors/exceptions from the
postgresql driver we should make an attempt to translate
those errors/exceptions into a equivalent tooz exception to
make it so that users of tooz can handle the known driver
failure modes in a sane manner (users expecting to user tooz
as a pluggable abstraction will not be able to handle raw
psycopg2 errors/exceptions, especially if those users are
using different tooz backends at the same time).

Change-Id: Ic95e5fa21bb25096a31b5c5e38aa0b14afa05d87

This script can be used to give some basic metrics about the
reliability of a cloud allowing us to make an informed decision about
its suitability for CI. As is parts of it could be improved but this can
be an exercise when burning in the next cloud.

It has been used in order to assess hp1 suitability to being added back
actively running CI jobs.

Change-Id: I239bfdfcabe0e3fe531c2751e9d1583b2bb9ee4d
'}]
commit_message:
Add a load test script - bighammer.sh

This script can be used to give some basic metrics about the
reliability of a cloud allowing us to make an informed decision about
its suitability for CI. As is parts of it could be improved but this can
be an exercise when burning in the next cloud.

It has been used in order to assess hp1 suitability to being added back
actively running CI jobs.

Change-Id: I239bfdfcabe0e3fe531c2751e9d1583b2bb9ee4d

commit_message:
Allow upgrades only from supported versions

Introduces the `can_upgrade_from` field which is a list of supported
versions. We can control upgrade process now by this field, so user
won't start upgrade from the Fuel versions that we have not tested for
upgrade.

Change-Id: Id56a09845ade075fa4751c7eb164e065d5cad2ef
Closes-Bug: #1392756

commit_message:
add a NoopPackagerMixin class

This is useful when no operating system could be detected or when there
is no PackagerMixin class for the specific operating system.

Also move the object parent class to BasePackagerMixin so the
NoopPackagerMixin can take advantage of it directly. (__getattribute__
needs new-style classes)

Change-Id: If5f3ef23d378ba79a741b1a7f7aa5048889c4bf3
Closes-Bug: #1347501

commit_message:
Add more env details into statistics snapshot

Following items are added:
* cluster attributes: common, storage, networking parameters, additional components,
  'vcenter', 'assign_public_to_all_nodes', 'syslog_transport', 'provision_method',
  'kernel_params', 'vlan_splinters'
* cluster parameters: 'net_provider', 'fuel_version', 'is_customized'
* node groups: 'id', 'node_id'
* node parameters: 'error_type', 'online', 'platform_name', 'pending_addition',
  'pending_deletion', 'pending_roles', 'nic_interfaces' (IDs only),
  'bond_interfaces' (IDs and slaves IDs)

Change-Id: I5b015e204c8a4777fcfb22f9a2bfe7e2c51ea992
Closes-Bug: #1393386

commit_message:
Fix comments in logrotation templates

W/o this fix, some log files at Openstack nodes cannot be rotated at the
hourly schedule and /var/log could end up having no free space while
waiting for the next daily based rotation schedule.

Closes-bug: #1393495

Change-Id: I192ebbd31f83fb264307c1c2f1e17a74cec933b3
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-14 08:13:51.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/admin/test_flavors_negative.py'], 'message': 'Fix empty string as id in create flavor request

test_get_flavor_details_for_deleted_flavor specify "" as the
id value for creating the flavor.

Nova V2 API validation is loose and the API accepts this
value. However, V2.1 API will not allow empty string as id.

This patch fix this by passing 'None' as id in this test.

Change-Id: I86419368a4c85aaf039278999d3d8c3c1e224c74
'}]
commit_message:
Fix empty string as id in create flavor request

test_get_flavor_details_for_deleted_flavor specify "" as the
id value for creating the flavor.

Nova V2 API validation is loose and the API accepts this
value. However, V2.1 API will not allow empty string as id.

This patch fix this by passing 'None' as id in this test.

revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2014-11-18 07:03:43.000000000', 'files': ['heat/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/048_resource_id_server_default_none_psql.py', 'heat/db/sqlalchemy/models.py'], 'message': 'Alter models and add migration

We must have correct models i.e. models that correspond
database schema to use sqlalchemy features.
Update models.py and add migration script to correct
database schema and get rid of the difference between
schema and models.
Remove Stack.user_creds_id nullable=False parameter
because  we can soft-delete stack, that leads to deletion
user_credits and setting stack.user_creds_id to null
(by cascade).
Remove resource.id default value(in database) as specified
in models.
Since we will have sync check between models and migrations
we need to add missing indexes to models for consistency.

Partially implements bp: db-sync-models-with-migrations

Change-Id: Iabc4aced0a95e29cea9c48abc4c31be98e8ff9b1
'}]
commit_message:
Alter models and add migration

We must have correct models i.e. models that correspond
database schema to use sqlalchemy features.
Update models.py and add migration script to correct
database schema and get rid of the difference between
schema and models.
Remove Stack.user_creds_id nullable=False parameter
because  we can soft-delete stack, that leads to deletion
user_credits and setting stack.user_creds_id to null
(by cascade).
Remove resource.id default value(in database) as specified
in models.
Since we will have sync check between models and migrations
we need to add missing indexes to models for consistency.

Partially implements bp: db-sync-models-with-migrations

Change-Id: Iabc4aced0a95e29cea9c48abc4c31be98e8ff9b1

As resource_setup() document says, we should check skip condition before

commit_message:
Fix resource_setup order in scenarios

As resource_setup() document says, we should check skip condition before
resource_setup. However some functions in scenarios setup resources
before skip checks. We should avoid to setup unnecessary resources as
possible. This commit fixes the order.

Change-Id: Id0529fc80f2b80f028fd078140fe5fd7459e9309

commit_message:
Migrate heat-api element to svc-map

This patch migrates the heat-api element from map-services to
svc-map by adding a svc-map file and adding the -a option to
os-svc-install script calls.

commit_message:
Fix comments in logrotation templates

W/o this fix, some log files at Openstack nodes cannot be rotated at the
hourly schedule and /var/log could end up having no free space while
waiting for the next daily based rotation schedule.

Closes-bug: #1393495

Change-Id: I192ebbd31f83fb264307c1c2f1e17a74cec933b3
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Isolate test from environment variables

One test ('test_get_client_all_creds') will fail if any of the typical
Openstack environment variables have been set (eg OS_PASSWORD).

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-11-14 21:03:07.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/clients/os/ceilometer.py'], 'message': "Fix incorrect ca argument for heat ceilometer client

Currently Heat ceilometer client are passing the wrong ca argument
during client instantiation. It will cause heat fail to connect to ceilometer
if it's configured with SSL.

https://github.com/openstack/python-ceilometerclient/blob/master/ceilometerclient/v2/client.py#L53

Closes-bug: #1391792

Change-Id: Ib32dfede0ece78bc39e0cab213cb51df8eb62eb6
"}]
commit_message:
Fix incorrect ca argument for heat ceilometer client

Currently Heat ceilometer client are passing the wrong ca argument
during client instantiation. It will cause heat fail to connect to ceilometer
if it's configured with SSL.

https://github.com/openstack/python-ceilometerclient/blob/master/ceilometerclient/v2/client.py#L53

Closes-bug: #1391792

Change-Id: Ib32dfede0ece78bc39e0cab213cb51df8eb62eb6

commit_message:
Fix listener for update.start notifications

When listening for update.start, ceilometer-notification-agent
will raise a KeyError exception. This is because, the "id" in notification
message is in message['payload'] not the message['payload'][resource].

Backport note, squashed with dependent patch:

  Don't override the original notification message
  (commit 4292ebd9d409a09b1e1f276ed447c82317cd14de)

Change-Id: I6dd56fbf31c29e26670068004f6fc935b91266f0
(cherry picked from commit 658b89941299370db67b34e8b26750f00c013ca9)
Closes-Bug: #1325172

commit_message:
Update oslo-config-generation code

Oslo's config generator has been moved under oslo.config, which doesn't
require using a bash script anymore.

The patch removes the old scripts and updates the generation task in
tox.ini

Closes-bug: #1373800

Change-Id: Ia757b0d141f8557144108d386496d1e9bfc7333f

commit_message:
Install the correct mysql-dev package for RHEL6

RHEL6/CentOS6 requires mysql-devel/mysql-lib packages instead of
libmysqlclient-dev for 'mysql-dev' element.

Change-Id: If5a004720b5982949568e5f79b887b9d5202a576
Closes-Bug: #1393313

commit_message:
Remove deprecation warnings relating to api-paste

Remove deprecation warnings and backwards compatibility introduced by
commit c355d68a. This commit was introduce in havana and backported to
grizzly. It relates to config options in api-paste.ini.

This commit removes the following deprecated items:
 * cinder.api.auth:CinderKeystoneContext
 * cinder.api.auth:pipeline_factory
 * cinder.api.openstack:FaultWrapper
 * cinder.api.openstack.urlmap:urlmap_factory
 * cinder.api.openstack.volume:APIRouter
 * cinder.api.openstack.volume.versions.Versions
 * cinder.api.sizelimit:RequestBodySizeLimiter

Change-Id: If7c055be0d257dee570da1db4adce2df6e73db14

subject: Curl statements to include globoff for IPv6 URLs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-14 14:31:19.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/openstack/common/apiclient/client.py', 'novaclient/tests/test_client.py', 'novaclient/client.py'], 'message': 'Curl statements to include globoff for IPv6 URLs

Novaclient displays curl statements for debugging/troubleshooting
purposes. For IPv6 URLs, curl requires --globoff to be passed in
the arguments. Since novaclient does not use curl directly, this
patch displays the curl commands with globoff option which works
for both IPv4 and IPv6 URLs.

Closes-Bug: #1228744
Change-Id: Ib7099e8e3bbc15f29bbaa1db37ef21e78a74e7bc
'}]
commit_message:
Curl statements to include globoff for IPv6 URLs

Novaclient displays curl statements for debugging/troubleshooting
purposes. For IPv6 URLs, curl requires --globoff to be passed in
the arguments. Since novaclient does not use curl directly, this
patch displays the curl commands with globoff option which works
for both IPv4 and IPv6 URLs.

Closes-Bug: #1228744
Change-Id: Ib7099e8e3bbc15f29bbaa1db37ef21e78a74e7bc

  metadata.json

  and vhost in RabbitMQ (+ unit tests)
* Documentation

commit_message:
Don't allow update of ipv6-ra-mode and ipv6-address-mode

These two parameters are not updatable from the nuetron server.
And therefore for subnet-update command, they should not be displayed
in the help message.

Change-Id: I3a6abc3a4e3030d73715d55c340a77b44d41f140
Closes-Bug: #1373417

commit_message:
Fixes neutronclient lb-member-show command

The current lb-member-show command uses the id or name for querying.
Since the lb members do not have names, the query returns false
positives.
The unit test for id or name was removed.
Closes-Bug: #1380937
Change-Id: I804cb9d11f5208ea2d7baa58c9d878db93851517

commit_message:
Remove nose things

We don't use nose anywhere in anything related to devstack. The only
legitimate OpenStack things that are still nose are horizon and swift
unittests, and it turns out we don't really run those in devstack.

Change-Id: I215e0f3664f269e0e1b8f5d5f9c70553dededddd

commit_message:
Add 'auth_password' in _SANITIZE_KEYS for strutils

Cinder volume drivers may return connection_info with'auth_password',
This is an example[1], to avoid auth_password to be logged in disk,
we should mask its value with "***".

[1] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/volume/drivers/ibm/storwize_svc/__init__.py#L432

Change-Id: Id8b67615efab1171e66b46550d5b01e1964f85a3

commit_message:
Use oslo.utils.netutils function to set tcp_keepalive

Use netutils.set_tcp_keepalive to set tcp keepalive parameters.
In addition to the existing conf option for tcp_keepidle, new
values were added for tcp_keepalive (to turn on/off this feature,
tcp_keepalive_interval (to specify gap between successive probes) and
tcp_keepalive_count (to specify number of probes).

Change-Id: I60c3bbf5f3deff8bdffe97af76052386e4598b45

commit_message:
Deprecate RetryDecorator for the retrying package

The RetryDecorator is heavy to maintain. oslo.vmware should
take advantage of the retrying pypi package.

This patches announces deprecation of the decorator and uses
retrying instead.

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 8759, 'name': 'Arnaud Legendre', 'email': 'arnaudleg@gmail.com', 'username': 'arnaud'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 9009, 'name': 'Red Hat CI', 'email': 'redhatci@redhat.com', 'username': 'redhatci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-07-18 01:12:40.000000000', 'files': ['lib/glance_backends/swift', 'lib/glance_backends/vsphere', 'lib/glance'], 'message': 'Add support for Glance store configuration

As of today, Glance is configured with the filesystem store unless the
swift screen session is started in which case the swift store will be
used.
In this patch, we provide the ability to run stack.sh with a specific
store and provide implementation for the VMware store and Swift.
Support for other stores (such as S3) will come in subsequent patches.

The localrc configuration for the VMware store should be:
GLANCE_STORE=vsphere
VMWAREAPI_IP=vcenter_ip
VMWAREAPI_USER=vcenter_login
VMWAREAPI_PASSWORD=vcenter_pw
VMWAREAPI_DATACENTER=datacenter_path
VMWAREAPI_DATASTORE=datastore_name

Change-Id: I3a0da29a9ded5708805e5971983f4ed75763ae93
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for Glance store configuration

As of today, Glance is configured with the filesystem store unless the
swift screen session is started in which case the swift store will be
used.
In this patch, we provide the ability to run stack.sh with a specific
store and provide implementation for the VMware store and Swift.
Support for other stores (such as S3) will come in subsequent patches.

The localrc configuration for the VMware store should be:
GLANCE_STORE=vsphere
VMWAREAPI_IP=vcenter_ip
VMWAREAPI_USER=vcenter_login
VMWAREAPI_PASSWORD=vcenter_pw
VMWAREAPI_DATACENTER=datacenter_path
VMWAREAPI_DATASTORE=datastore_name

Change-Id: I3a0da29a9ded5708805e5971983f4ed75763ae93

subject: Metadata API and VC Metadata implementation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-24 01:15:42.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/vmware/metadata/__init__.py', 'etc/vcenter.cfg', 'requirements.txt', 'tests/integration/__init__.py', 'tests/integration/test_vc_metadata.py', 'oslo/vmware/metadata/vc_metadata.py', 'oslo/vmware/metadata/base.py', 'tests/test_vc_metadata.py'], 'message': 'Metadata API and VC Metadata implementation

OpenStack compute nodes need to persist some data in vCenter. For
example, to make iSCSI work correctly we need to persist the
static targets used by the hosts in the cluster and created through
OpenStack.

This patch defines a very generic interface of a key-value store and
provides an implementation backed by the CustomFieldManager of vCenter.

This patch comes with unit and integration tests.

Change-Id: I530ab5a77db2d39b2f283c10083b9d9562a0c2b6
'}]
commit_message:
Metadata API and VC Metadata implementation

OpenStack compute nodes need to persist some data in vCenter. For
example, to make iSCSI work correctly we need to persist the
static targets used by the hosts in the cluster and created through
OpenStack.

This patch defines a very generic interface of a key-value store and
provides an implementation backed by the CustomFieldManager of vCenter.

This patch comes with unit and integration tests.

Change-Id: I530ab5a77db2d39b2f283c10083b9d9562a0c2b6

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 8412, 'name': 'Mike Durnosvistov', 'email': 'glacierr.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'mdurnosvistov'}, {'_account_id': 8759, 'name': 'Arnaud Legendre', 'email': 'arnaudleg@gmail.com', 'username': 'arnaud'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-06-18 23:12:40.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/volumeops.py', 'nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_volumeops.py'], 'message': 'VMware: Remove target from all hosts on detach_vol

With change I787b68c51937abfa592b0e5dcdfbf937a9f2b656, we propagate
iSCSI targets to all hosts of the cluster. However, the targets
are not removed from the hosts when detaching the volume.
This patch addresses the issue by spawning an asynchronous operation
which is removing the static target from all the hosts of the cluster.
This will work fine in a steady system. If the compute node dies when
removing the target, the administrator would have to remove it
manually if there is a real need to remove it.

Closes-Bug: #1331321
Change-Id: I9482254d830e12e72a5687ab4cf391a4a496d087
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: Remove target from all hosts on detach_vol

With change I787b68c51937abfa592b0e5dcdfbf937a9f2b656, we propagate
iSCSI targets to all hosts of the cluster. However, the targets
are not removed from the hosts when detaching the volume.
This patch addresses the issue by spawning an asynchronous operation
which is removing the static target from all the hosts of the cluster.
This will work fine in a steady system. If the compute node dies when
removing the target, the administrator would have to remove it
manually if there is a real need to remove it.

Closes-Bug: #1331321
Change-Id: I9482254d830e12e72a5687ab4cf391a4a496d087

[{'number': 9, 'created': '2014-06-18 22:40:02.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/volumeops.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/vm_util.py', 'nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_vm_util.py', 'nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_driver_api.py', 'nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_volumeops.py'], 'message': "VMware: Propagate static targets on attach_volume

As soon as a user attaches a Cinder iSCSI volume to a VM,
the host where the VM is running establishes a connection with
the remote iSCSI target. This is good as long as vMotion is not part of
the picture. Indeed, vMotion will be a no-op if the target host
where the VM should be relocated doesn't know about the iSCSI target.
This patch addresses the issue by starting an asynchronous operation
on attach_volume() which will propagate the static targets to all the
hosts of the cluster.
The operation is asynchronous due to the fact that the scan operation
might take a couple of seconds.
If the compute node goes down when progagating, the next attach_volume
will propagate again.
vCenter deduplicates the same static targets automatically so we are
sure
that we always have a set of unique static targets.
This patch doesn't leverage discovery addresses but only static targets
which has the advantage of avoiding noise of unused targets in the SCSI
topology.

Closes-Bug: #1330758
Change-Id: I787b68c51937abfa592b0e5dcdfbf937a9f2b656
"}]
commit_message:
VMware: Propagate static targets on attach_volume

As soon as a user attaches a Cinder iSCSI volume to a VM,
the host where the VM is running establishes a connection with
the remote iSCSI target. This is good as long as vMotion is not part of
the picture. Indeed, vMotion will be a no-op if the target host
where the VM should be relocated doesn't know about the iSCSI target.
This patch addresses the issue by starting an asynchronous operation
on attach_volume() which will propagate the static targets to all the
hosts of the cluster.
The operation is asynchronous due to the fact that the scan operation
might take a couple of seconds.
If the compute node goes down when progagating, the next attach_volume
will propagate again.
vCenter deduplicates the same static targets automatically so we are
sure
that we always have a set of unique static targets.
This patch doesn't leverage discovery addresses but only static targets
which has the advantage of avoiding noise of unused targets in the SCSI
topology.

Closes-Bug: #1330758
Change-Id: I787b68c51937abfa592b0e5dcdfbf937a9f2b656

commit_message:
Add retrying to global-requirements

Retrying is an Apache 2.0 licensed general-purpose retrying library,
written in Python, to simplify the task of adding retry behavior.

Retrying would be useful for the following projects:
- glance
- oslo
- nova
- certainly more...

Useful in the context of:
- session timeout
- retry on specific exception
- etc.

Change-Id: I11c20997d6b7ce37943b55c759845a3e655c84d3
(cherry-pick from 1b20d2775d2b6284962ed125495548273ba5cb0f)

subject: VMware store: Get rid of api_insecure
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-18 04:48:46.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/unit/test_vmware_store.py', 'glance/tests/functional/store/test_vmware_datastore.py', 'etc/glance-api.conf', 'glance/store/vmware_datastore.py'], 'message': "VMware store: Get rid of api_insecure

The configuration variable api_insecure used by the VMware datastore
is misleading. In the cinder client, api_insecure set to True means
that the SSL certificates won't be checked when establishing an SSL
connection. However, the implementation of the VMware store is using
this variable to choose between HTTP or HTTPS.

This patch renames the variable vmware_api_insecure to
vmware_https_connection which is much more explicit for deployers.

Change-Id: Icefa94b8de166802262d1146b9b78efce3a0c077
Closes-Bug: #1309338
"}]
commit_message:
VMware store: Get rid of api_insecure

The configuration variable api_insecure used by the VMware datastore
is misleading. In the cinder client, api_insecure set to True means
that the SSL certificates won't be checked when establishing an SSL
connection. However, the implementation of the VMware store is using
this variable to choose between HTTP or HTTPS.

This patch renames the variable vmware_api_insecure to
vmware_https_connection which is much more explicit for deployers.

Change-Id: Icefa94b8de166802262d1146b9b78efce3a0c077
Closes-Bug: #1309338

commit_message:
Drop usage of RpcProxy from DhcpPluginApi

Drop the usage of the RpcProxy compatibility class from the
DhcpPluginApi RPC client class.  The implementation has been updated
to use the appropariate APIs from oslo.messaging directly.

Part of blueprint drop-rpc-compat.

commit_message:
Support using the Keystone V3 API from the Nova CLI

This changeset enables support for Keystone V3 authentication
on the Nova CLI. This provides consistency between using
novaclient as the Nova CLI and using it as a library
as the Keystone V3 support already exists for the libary usecase.

The bulk of the change surrounds the use of the keystoneclient
session object for authentication, retriving the service catalog,
and HTTP connection/session management.

Co-Authored-By: Morgan Fainberg <morgan.fainberg@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Iece9f41320a8770176c7eeb5acd86be4d80cc58f

Enhance the sidebar display to provide visual distinction between top
level items and lower level items. Top level items are now given a
space above them so they are visually clumped with their children, and
separated from each other. They are also emboldened for greater visual
distinction.

Ideally sphinx would actually tag li items with their depth as a class

Change-Id: I88d4317ec69fe7fd6f5c2198f89de624f0d093da

commit_message:
provide visual separation in sidebar

Enhance the sidebar display to provide visual distinction between top
level items and lower level items. Top level items are now given a
space above them so they are visually clumped with their children, and
separated from each other. They are also emboldened for greater visual
distinction.

Ideally sphinx would actually tag li items with their depth as a class
tag, but as it currently doesn't do that we can work around it with
setting at ul li, and unsetting at ul li ul li.

Change-Id: I88d4317ec69fe7fd6f5c2198f89de624f0d093da

Another external library change (oslo.db) has broken the gate
because cinder.conf.sample appears to be out of date.  The change
was just to a message string:

   Maximum number of database connection retries during
   startup. Set to -1 to specify an infinite retry count. (integer value)
   ->
   Maximum db connection retries during startup. Set to -1 to
   specify an infinite retry count. (integer value)

This patch updates cinder.conf.sample to get beyond this failure.  The
Cinder team will be talking about how to avoid these issues in the future.

Change-Id: Ia14954842d141b9bd208ce98c5a70a42b014ac45
'}]
commit_message:
Update cinder.conf.sample to fix max db conn retries

Another external library change (oslo.db) has broken the gate
because cinder.conf.sample appears to be out of date.  The change
was just to a message string:

   Maximum number of database connection retries during
   startup. Set to -1 to specify an infinite retry count. (integer value)
   ->
   Maximum db connection retries during startup. Set to -1 to
   specify an infinite retry count. (integer value)

This patch updates cinder.conf.sample to get beyond this failure.  The
Cinder team will be talking about how to avoid these issues in the future.

Change-Id: Ia14954842d141b9bd208ce98c5a70a42b014ac45

commit_message:
Move out of the oslo namespace package

Move the public API out of oslo.concurrency to oslo_concurrency. Retain
the ability to import from the old namespace package for backwards
compatibility for this release cycle.

bp/drop-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I20d1647b1c3ef8cab3b69eccfe168eeb01703b72

commit_message:
Implement Midonet Juno Security Group Api calls

This patch is part of a series of patches converting the current midonet plugin
code to the new model described in blueprint midonet-plugin-juno. This patch
focuses specifically on the "security group" handlers.

Change-Id: I76d3c8809aff2fc1b74de0fab6712b8495d1413b
Partially-Implements: blueprint midonet-plugin-juno

commit_message:
Fix L2 agent does not remove unused ipset set

The patch fixes L2 agent does not remove unused ipset set when security
group contains rules for only IPv4 or IPv6.

Change-Id: I375b1683cd763c0a33dc935558c637874d36ffa1
Closes-bug: #1373287

subject: Exclude testtools 1.4.0
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-11-17 22:44:29.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Exclude testtools 1.4.0

When running tempest with testtools 1.4.0 attributes aren't being added to the
test_id. This causes the regex excludes we use for the slow tests in tempest to not
work, and the slow jobs get run everywhere, while the slow jobs fail to have any tests. 

Change-Id: I561e98bf363d2dd8e8b3a20cea7d2dcbfa034e98
"}]
commit_message:
Exclude testtools 1.4.0

When running tempest with testtools 1.4.0 attributes aren't being added to the
test_id. This causes the regex excludes we use for the slow tests in tempest to not
work, and the slow jobs get run everywhere, while the slow jobs fail to have any tests. 

Change-Id: I561e98bf363d2dd8e8b3a20cea7d2dcbfa034e98

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-11-17 13:02:41.000000000', 'files': ['tests/functional/wsgi/v1_1/test_claims.py'], 'message': "Claim post requires a body

One of the claim's test scenario used to send `None` to the server. The
later failed to deserialize this body and the response returned 400.
This patch removes `None` from the test scenario since a body is
requires to created a claim to begin with.

Change-Id: If2c6acefc84fb2b7cc5b4a26e1784b74a1ae1e22
Closes-bug: #1383604"}]
commit_message:
Claim post requires a body

One of the claim's test scenario used to send `None` to the server. The
later failed to deserialize this body and the response returned 400.
This patch removes `None` from the test scenario since a body is
requires to created a claim to begin with.

Change-Id: If2c6acefc84fb2b7cc5b4a26e1784b74a1ae1e22
Closes-bug: #1383604

commit_message:
Add uuidutils to oslo.utils

Oslo team was vacillating about moving uuidutils to
oslo.utils in the past. The consensus now is that it
may be still handy and has too many references for us
to fix (change references from uuidutils to use uuid.*
package directly)

Co-Authored-By: Victor Sergeyev <vsergeyev@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I1b2e430915125da6cf505a8525c148898e8ec08a

subject: Prevent infinite loop in token_flush
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-30 00:20:49.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/token/persistence/backends/sql.py'], 'message': 'Prevent infinite loop in token_flush

If there were > batch_size tokens with the same expiration time then
token_flush could hang because it picks the expiration time as the
target to delete with a < check.

The check is changed to a <= so that the tokens in the batch are
deleted so that token_flush always makes progress.

Change-Id: Id0b6f7fcdf7ebb02a6f38fbb9a4e25bf714a614c
Closes-Bug: #1387401
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent infinite loop in token_flush

If there were > batch_size tokens with the same expiration time then
token_flush could hang because it picks the expiration time as the
target to delete with a < check.

The check is changed to a <= so that the tokens in the batch are
deleted so that token_flush always makes progress.

Change-Id: Id0b6f7fcdf7ebb02a6f38fbb9a4e25bf714a614c
Closes-Bug: #1387401

subject: Fix ReST exception mapping
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-08-12 11:37:30.000000000', 'files': ['trove/common/wsgi.py', 'trove/tests/api/mgmt/accounts.py', 'trove/tests/api/mgmt/instances.py', 'trove/tests/api/mgmt/admin_required.py'], 'message': 'Fix ReST exception mapping

Reasons:
- When regular user tries to access admin API
  endpoints Trove will raise H401 exception
  (Unauthorized), but user passed authorization.
- webob has specific section for HTTP Forbidden exceptions.
- This issue violates RFC 2616.

Changes:
- fixing exception mapping.
- fixing tests.

Change-Id: I840360c2077d6c75279894d6eecd65a8cdeb8f6c
Closes-Bug: #1351296
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ReST exception mapping

Reasons:
- When regular user tries to access admin API
  endpoints Trove will raise H401 exception
  (Unauthorized), but user passed authorization.
- webob has specific section for HTTP Forbidden exceptions.
- This issue violates RFC 2616.

Changes:
- fixing exception mapping.
- fixing tests.

Change-Id: I840360c2077d6c75279894d6eecd65a8cdeb8f6c
Closes-Bug: #1351296

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1192, 'name': 'David Kranz', 'email': 'dkranz@redhat.com', 'username': 'david-kranz'}, {'_account_id': 2035, 'name': 'Maru Newby', 'email': 'marun@redhat.com', 'username': 'maru'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-07-15 19:19:01.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/network/test_floating_ips.py', 'tempest/services/network/network_client_base.py', 'tempest/api/network/base.py'], 'message': 'Sample of refactoring test code for a retargetable client

The goal is to move the following out of tests into the client:
1. validation
2. serialize/deserialize
3. resource management using addCleanUp

The client will return an object as an attribute dict so members can be
access with instance variable syntax.

This change allows an abstract definition of the client interface which
will allow decoupling of "where the tests live" and "what client is used".
Clients might be a tempest client, official client, or direct API calls to
a project.

In this sample, references to values in ports and fixed ips still use dict
syntax because those clients were not changed. The new client methods are
prepended with x_ in this sample to prevent other unmodified tests from
failing.

Change-Id: I8be2f4bec5eb4cdf0efcbbd26ce090501b8e8c30
'}]
commit_message:
Sample of refactoring test code for a retargetable client

The goal is to move the following out of tests into the client:
1. validation
2. serialize/deserialize
3. resource management using addCleanUp

The client will return an object as an attribute dict so members can be
access with instance variable syntax.

This change allows an abstract definition of the client interface which
will allow decoupling of "where the tests live" and "what client is used".
Clients might be a tempest client, official client, or direct API calls to
a project.

In this sample, references to values in ports and fixed ips still use dict
syntax because those clients were not changed. The new client methods are
prepended with x_ in this sample to prevent other unmodified tests from
failing.

Change-Id: I8be2f4bec5eb4cdf0efcbbd26ce090501b8e8c30

subject: Fix check for image existence
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-12 16:53:05.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/acquire-image'], 'message': "Fix check for image existence

Having the image_exists call inside the brackets causes it to be a
noop, which means that if you try to run devtest with -c but
without a seed image present it won't properly recognize that and
build one.

Change-Id: I560b9ac381d1c0a544f35de607405ad04b41eff8
"}]
commit_message:
Fix check for image existence

Having the image_exists call inside the brackets causes it to be a
noop, which means that if you try to run devtest with -c but
without a seed image present it won't properly recognize that and
build one.

Change-Id: I560b9ac381d1c0a544f35de607405ad04b41eff8

subject: Add synchronized_domain decorator
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-11-17 19:03:18.000000000', 'files': ['designate/central/service.py'], 'message': 'Add synchronized_domain decorator

As a temporary fix for bug 1392762, we serialize concurrent
modifications to a domain, preventing the issue described in
the bug. We choose a temporary fix, as pools will make a no
locking fix significantly easier.

Closes-Bug: 1392762
Change-Id: Ifb1bba170983023aedbc63ed3559fe8b28359efa
'}]
commit_message:
Add synchronized_domain decorator

As a temporary fix for bug 1392762, we serialize concurrent
modifications to a domain, preventing the issue described in
the bug. We choose a temporary fix, as pools will make a no
locking fix significantly easier.

Closes-Bug: 1392762
Change-Id: Ifb1bba170983023aedbc63ed3559fe8b28359efa

subject: Correct use of the image_exists function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-14 15:25:48.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/acquire-image'], 'message': 'Correct use of the image_exists function

Since image_exists is a function we don't need to
wrap it in []'s when testing that is passes. Doing
so actually means it will always render true.

Do this instead:

 if image_exists && [ -n "$USE_CACHE" ]; then

Change-Id: I9cbb5e74a038b157c75d1c91bef086a620b1cca6
'}]
commit_message:
Correct use of the image_exists function

Since image_exists is a function we don't need to
wrap it in []'s when testing that is passes. Doing
so actually means it will always render true.

Do this instead:

 if image_exists && [ -n "$USE_CACHE" ]; then

Change-Id: I9cbb5e74a038b157c75d1c91bef086a620b1cca6

subject: Fix call to show_options if no BUILD_COMMAND set
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-14 14:13:12.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/acquire-image'], 'message': "Fix call to show_options if no BUILD_COMMAND set

Fixes an issue where if you called acquire-image with less
that 2 ARGS it would fail without printing any error message.
This is because the IMAGE_NAME and/or BUILD_COMMAND variables
were obtained from $1 which may or may not be set.

To work around this we do a simple error check on the number of args
before setting (and checking) these variables. This makes it
so acquire-image properly prints its usuage message if args aren't
present.

Change-Id: Iaa1209923fd5259a153312df65519d31f1d929a1
"}]
commit_message:
Fix call to show_options if no BUILD_COMMAND set

Fixes an issue where if you called acquire-image with less
that 2 ARGS it would fail without printing any error message.
This is because the IMAGE_NAME and/or BUILD_COMMAND variables
were obtained from $1 which may or may not be set.

To work around this we do a simple error check on the number of args
before setting (and checking) these variables. This makes it
so acquire-image properly prints its usuage message if args aren't
present.

Change-Id: Iaa1209923fd5259a153312df65519d31f1d929a1

commit_message:
Improve wait-for-* execs

Right after start haproxy marks all backends as UP. It marks
problem ones as DOWN only after health-checks. So we should not
rely on BACKEND status while INI is in process.

Change-Id: Ia3743d446826ee1a9d42799a83e14a911a577966
Related-bug: #1391180
(cherry picked from commit 360ef59e8f828243304a669328257be8504b8df6)

When running watchers we scan over all the currently existing
groups, during this scan of groups and associated members we
can determine if the the member that the driver represents has
been kicked out of the group and clean out our '_joined_group'
set when this has been detected.

Change-Id: Ib17543f2401804d2d3573d9b8bdeb55cb2c9f606
"}]
commit_message:
Discard 'self' from '_joined_groups' if we got booted out

When running watchers we scan over all the currently existing
groups, during this scan of groups and associated members we
can determine if the the member that the driver represents has
been kicked out of the group and clean out our '_joined_group'
set when this has been detected.

Change-Id: Ib17543f2401804d2d3573d9b8bdeb55cb2c9f606

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-11-17 15:04:01.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/dhcp_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_dhcp_agent.py'], 'message': "Fix client side versions in dhcp rpc API

The dhcp rpc API has two version (1.0 and 1.1).  The proper way to use
versioning for this is to only specify '1.1' from the client side when
you require that the remote side implements at least version '1.1' for
the method to work.  Otherwise, '1.0' should still be specified.  The
previous code specified '1.1' always.

Related to blueprint drop-rpc-compat.

Change-Id: I9468f8f67d80c5d064137f917fc04f9335a3ed55
"}]
commit_message:
Fix client side versions in dhcp rpc API

The dhcp rpc API has two version (1.0 and 1.1).  The proper way to use
versioning for this is to only specify '1.1' from the client side when
you require that the remote side implements at least version '1.1' for
the method to work.  Otherwise, '1.0' should still be specified.  The
previous code specified '1.1' always.

Related to blueprint drop-rpc-compat.

Change-Id: I9468f8f67d80c5d064137f917fc04f9335a3ed55

subject: Add gate hook scripts for functional tests
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-11-15 11:55:49.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/ci/pre_test_hook.sh', 'contrib/ci/post_test_hook.sh', 'manilaclient/config.py'], 'message': 'Add gate hook scripts for functional tests

Add gate hook to contrib/ci dir to be able to configure functional tests job.

pre_test_hook just imports devstack extension for manila project to the
devstack project.
post_test_hook configures config file for manilaclient based on devstack
installation and runs related tox job.

Also fix default config file path within config module.

Partially implements bp functional-tests

Change-Id: Ibf90af083b9a8e0ec646e1bff676893528ff1914
'}]
commit_message:
Add gate hook scripts for functional tests

Add gate hook to contrib/ci dir to be able to configure functional tests job.

pre_test_hook just imports devstack extension for manila project to the
devstack project.
post_test_hook configures config file for manilaclient based on devstack
installation and runs related tox job.

Also fix default config file path within config module.

Partially implements bp functional-tests

Change-Id: Ibf90af083b9a8e0ec646e1bff676893528ff1914

commit_message:
Adds host power actions support for Hyper-V

This patch introduces host power off and host reboot
support for the Nova Hyper-V driver.

Startup cannot be supported as the driver runs on the
host itself.

Implements: blueprint hyper-v-host-power-actions

Change-Id: I86ca35ff2527f643d72fb949870da69ce63277ae

subject: Add requirement for APIImpact flag
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-31 20:16:03.000000000', 'files': ['specs/template.rst'], 'message': 'Add requirement for APIImpact flag

Adds a requirement for an APIImpact flag in
the commit message for a proposed spec if it proposes
changes to the Trove REST API. This will make it
much easier for people such as the API WG who want to
review API changes across OpenStack to find and
review proposed API changes.

Change-Id: Ic3a6c3ef65fc0ccbdffe24903faf7c7a99d49d88
'}]
commit_message:
Add requirement for APIImpact flag

Adds a requirement for an APIImpact flag in
the commit message for a proposed spec if it proposes
changes to the Trove REST API. This will make it
much easier for people such as the API WG who want to
review API changes across OpenStack to find and
review proposed API changes.

Change-Id: Ic3a6c3ef65fc0ccbdffe24903faf7c7a99d49d88

commit_message:
Return the correct RRSet object in Central.create_recordset

Previously, we returned the input RecordSet, rather than the newly
created RecordSet object. This likely hasn't caused any harm, but
was inconsistent with all the other create_ methods.

Change-Id: I75342cda4e1d7a46a28d471261d51c954c333f2b

commit_message:
Bug in CLI when pointing to Solum API directly

The Solum_url property is being deleted and used later.
This is a bug and won't allow the CLI to talk to the
Solum API directly. There is no need to delete it.

Change-Id: I58a898833909d652e667818101672482f49a7114

subject: Add keystone session support to client
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-11-13 15:39:27.000000000', 'files': ['muranoclient/v1/client.py', 'muranoclient/common/http.py'], 'message': "Add keystone session support to client

To support keystone v3 requires support of keystone sessions,
which handle authenticating and creating http requests. In itself
this patch doesn't make anything new happen and should be followed
by another that tells the CLI to use SessionClient, but it adds
the support to do so.

Change-Id: I77093fbe6db968cfa6fa4ef71caa800573f7736e
Partially-implements: blueprint support-keystone-v3
"}]
commit_message:
Add keystone session support to client

To support keystone v3 requires support of keystone sessions,
which handle authenticating and creating http requests. In itself
this patch doesn't make anything new happen and should be followed
by another that tells the CLI to use SessionClient, but it adds
the support to do so.

Change-Id: I77093fbe6db968cfa6fa4ef71caa800573f7736e
Partially-implements: blueprint support-keystone-v3

commit_message:
Change DHCP network schedule interface to accept id

Currently passing whole network dict to schedule() method is
redundant. Scheduler can query network directly if it needs it.
Fix UT accordingly

Change-Id: Ifb340afc8bd58c33df1505ad0ca2ba160f05d72c

commit_message:
Add default file I/O implementation for volume migration

This patch adds a default implementation for the volume open and close
methods.  These methods assume volumes are attachable and serve as an
initial working implementation to next add specific support for
non-attachable volumes.

Related-Blueprint: generic-volume-migration
Change-Id: Ie8ae18c33d0f9750ac1ba8404167f1a1176039f7

commit_message:
Add volume migration support for source RBD volumes

This patch implements the volume open and close routines allowing volume
migration when the source volume is of type RBD to succeed.  RBD
destination volumes are still to come.

Related-Blueprint: generic-volume-migration
Change-Id: Iffadb089f6c610f7c89dae718ffd28287e6f035a

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-08-29 16:25:24.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py', 'cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/volume/driver.py', 'cinder/tests/test_rbd.py', 'cinder/volume/rpcapi.py', 'cinder/tests/test_volume.py'], 'message': "Introduce changes necessary for generic volume migration

This patch contains the core driver changes needed to make generic
volume migration possible.  By itself, no changes to the existing logic
for volume migration are introduced.  The intent is to keep the original
behaviour intact while allowing certain drivers that cannot attach
volumes locally to still participate in volume migration.

To allow this functionality, an 'is_attachable' function is added to the
volume driver definition.  This property indicates whether the volume
can be attached locally to the host and expose a path to the resulting
block device.  A driver author can override this and return False if
a driver cannot attach its volumes in a way that exposes a block device
path.  Doing so will cause the volume copy routine (copy_volume_data) to
use file I/O instead of calling out to `dd`.  The driver author is
expected to provide an implementation of open_volume() that returns
a file object capable of proxying I/O requests to the underlying storage
backend.

An RPC call for 'is_attachable' is added to allow querying of remote
volume capabilities.

The default volume open and close routines are currently unimplemented
and are the next step in this series.  The open routine will return
a file handle defined by the path to the block device.  This will allow
drivers like RBD which do not support attachment to migrate to and from
drivers which do support attachment, such as LVM.

Related-Blueprint: generic-volume-migration
Change-Id: I96bb677fb89f7e1721572bca9ed48995df33bcd0
"}]
commit_message:
Introduce changes necessary for generic volume migration

This patch contains the core driver changes needed to make generic
volume migration possible.  By itself, no changes to the existing logic
for volume migration are introduced.  The intent is to keep the original
behaviour intact while allowing certain drivers that cannot attach
volumes locally to still participate in volume migration.

To allow this functionality, an 'is_attachable' function is added to the
volume driver definition.  This property indicates whether the volume
can be attached locally to the host and expose a path to the resulting
block device.  A driver author can override this and return False if
a driver cannot attach its volumes in a way that exposes a block device
path.  Doing so will cause the volume copy routine (copy_volume_data) to
use file I/O instead of calling out to `dd`.  The driver author is
expected to provide an implementation of open_volume() that returns
a file object capable of proxying I/O requests to the underlying storage
backend.

An RPC call for 'is_attachable' is added to allow querying of remote
volume capabilities.

The default volume open and close routines are currently unimplemented
and are the next step in this series.  The open routine will return
a file handle defined by the path to the block device.  This will allow
drivers like RBD which do not support attachment to migrate to and from
drivers which do support attachment, such as LVM.

Related-Blueprint: generic-volume-migration
Change-Id: I96bb677fb89f7e1721572bca9ed48995df33bcd0

subject: Test nodepool provided addresses in aiopcpu setup
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-10-28 18:51:14.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh'], 'message': 'Test nodepool provided addresses in aiopcpu setup

Existing change determines node IPs by interrogating the `ip` command on
each host. Nodepool provides info about the public IP of each host to
the test nodes. Just use the nodepool provided IPs.

Change-Id: Iaad8b25fa8606fa77daa2f6096c8b1a6a5d146ae

commit_message:
Test nodepool provided addresses in aiopcpu setup

Existing change determines node IPs by interrogating the `ip` command on
each host. Nodepool provides info about the public IP of each host to
the test nodes. Just use the nodepool provided IPs.

Change-Id: Iaad8b25fa8606fa77daa2f6096c8b1a6a5d146ae

subject: add a Rakefile to structure test runs
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-11-17 11:08:00.000000000', 'files': ['TESTING.md', '.gitignore', 'Rakefile', 'Gemfile', 'Strainerfile', '.rubocop.yml'], 'message': "add a Rakefile to structure test runs

Having a Rakefile will allow us to change the actual test commands on
our side rather than relying on changes to the openstack-infra
repository. This should make it a lot faster to change things, but also
easier to test since the jenkins jobs are actually run in this
repository, not the openstack-infra one.

This commit defines the jobs we previously had defined in Jenkins and
uses 'high-level' naming consistently (i.e. lint, style vs. foodcritic,
rubocop).

There is also a :clean task to help with deleting the files generated by
the other jobs.

Also changed foodcritic to run on the source cookbook rather than the
one installed by berks, see
e.g. https://github.com/berkshelf/berkshelf/issues/931#issuecomment-29668369

Change-Id: Id085444027efd90049508abe6a309fed7dfffee8
blueprint: rakefile
"}]
commit_message:
add a Rakefile to structure test runs

Having a Rakefile will allow us to change the actual test commands on
our side rather than relying on changes to the openstack-infra
repository. This should make it a lot faster to change things, but also
easier to test since the jenkins jobs are actually run in this
repository, not the openstack-infra one.

This commit defines the jobs we previously had defined in Jenkins and
uses 'high-level' naming consistently (i.e. lint, style vs. foodcritic,
rubocop).

There is also a :clean task to help with deleting the files generated by
the other jobs.

Also changed foodcritic to run on the source cookbook rather than the
one installed by berks, see
e.g. https://github.com/berkshelf/berkshelf/issues/931#issuecomment-29668369

Change-Id: Id085444027efd90049508abe6a309fed7dfffee8
blueprint: rakefile

commit_message:
Make utils.universalUnmount work with all components

There was a common pattern to universally unmount any React component.
Now it doesn't work with component which render to null, so I created
this workaround and a bug in React's Github:

https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/2545

Closes-Bug: #1393367

Change-Id: Id7f7b8f4daa7f4d8272a1fe8362cbad31f680a12

In current nova api, there is no constraints for quota updates with provided

commit_message:
Add uuid hex check before updating the quotas

In current nova api, there is no constraints for quota updates with provided
tenant_id or user_id arguments. User can use tenant_name or user_name for update
and get operation success but actually these quotas does not take effect for
deployments. Only quota updates with ids could work. This fix will validate
uuid format before quota updates.

For tenant_id or user_id validation by keystone, it's covered in blueprint
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/validate-tenant-user-with-keystone
which is pendding approval.

Change-Id: Ie84f4b93893a76f041be754e25e9c17b37e854aa
Closes-Bug: #1333571

subject: Mask token in debug output
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-08-18 18:40:24.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_swiftclient.py', 'swiftclient/utils.py', 'swiftclient/client.py'], 'message': "Mask token in debug output

Replaying the token in debug output is both completely burdensome to
read (given it's unbounded size), but it's also potentially a security
issue given that it could be used in replay attacks.

Instead, filter the headers to sha1 sensitive things, with X-Auth-Token
being the only one listed so far. The sha1 will at least give us the
understanding of tokens being the same or different (and an administrator
could use that to figure out if they were valid later).

This also removes some extra '\n' that were being injected into the
debug logs, because they were not helping with readability.

Lastly, actually test logging. This introduces the first tests of the
logging path using the logging fixture. It's pretty basic, but does
verify that requests are logged at debug, that the SHA1 format works,
and that headers which are not listed get shown straight through.

DocImpact because this changes the curl dumped strings which people
may have been using. They can still do that as long as they generate
their own keystone token.

(Patch and commit message inspired from Sean Dague's novaclient
implementation)

Change-Id: I728fc2db0590d5893d571ffcbf10b9b20821d147
"}]
commit_message:
Mask token in debug output

Replaying the token in debug output is both completely burdensome to
read (given it's unbounded size), but it's also potentially a security
issue given that it could be used in replay attacks.

Instead, filter the headers to sha1 sensitive things, with X-Auth-Token
being the only one listed so far. The sha1 will at least give us the
understanding of tokens being the same or different (and an administrator
could use that to figure out if they were valid later).

This also removes some extra '\n' that were being injected into the
debug logs, because they were not helping with readability.

Lastly, actually test logging. This introduces the first tests of the
logging path using the logging fixture. It's pretty basic, but does
verify that requests are logged at debug, that the SHA1 format works,
and that headers which are not listed get shown straight through.

DocImpact because this changes the curl dumped strings which people
may have been using. They can still do that as long as they generate
their own keystone token.

(Patch and commit message inspired from Sean Dague's novaclient
implementation)

Change-Id: I728fc2db0590d5893d571ffcbf10b9b20821d147

commit_message:
Add --dry-run option to swift-ring-builder rebalance

The rebalanced ring is not written when used with option --dry-run.
This can be used to modify device weight and check for changes before
writing the modified ring, without the need to restore from the latest
version in directory backups/.

Change-Id: I5e9c407c0bf9ea9a61ca778a865878b57e9ebae2

commit_message:
Switch off Nova V2 XML Support

Tempest has a switch to disable tests that exercise the
Nova V2 XML API support. We need a way to enable/disable
this flag in devstack. Also we disable these tests by default.
